Job Description:
Strats - Quantitative Analyst


Job title: Strats – Quantitative Analyst
Reports to: Head of Strats
Contract: Permanent

Responsibilities:

Strategists occupy the intersection of finance, markets, maths, computer science, and programming. Working side by side with the firm’s trading, sales, banking and investment management professionals, members of the business unit use their mathematical and scientific training to create financial products, advise clients on transactions, measure risk and identify market opportunities.

Our quantitative analysts focus on the pricing and
risk management of complex transactions, ranging from pension fund buyout
trades to exotic assets and derivatives. We are looking for some who can work
on a large project, develop cutting edge analytics, and implement production
quality pricing, analysis and risk management systems.

In their daily work, Strats work closely with our traders and structuring teams, analysing trades and asset origination opportunities for execution and ongoing measurement and management. This emphasis on advanced financial mathematics and a highly analytical approach as an integral part of the risk management of the firm distinguishes Rothesay Life from many of its competitors. In general, we are looking for smart, quantitative, commercial, problem-solving-oriented, “get-things-done” candidates with the skills to deliver robust, high performance software and quantitative analyses and with either experience in financial markets or a keen interest to learn about them.

Skills and Experience:

Required:

margin-left:18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt">=
Advanced quantitative skills (typically evidenced by a degree in maths,
physics, computer science, engineering, etc.)

margin-left:18.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt">=
Excellence in applied programming skills - Python, C, C++ or other major
languages.

Preferred:

=
Knowledge of financial mathematics and stochastic
calculus.

=
Understanding of Fixed Income products and
derivatives.

=
Experience in creating and validating pricing and/or risk models
for use in a financial services organisation

Competencies
Technical Skills - Demonstrates strong technical skills required for the role, pays attention to detail, takes initiative to broaden his/her knowledge and demonstrates appropriate analytical skills
Drive and Motivation – Be a self-starter; successfully handles multiple tasks, takes initiative to improve his/her own performance, works intensely towards extremely challenging goals and persists in the face of obstacles or setbacks
Client and Business Focus - Effectively handles difficult requests, builds trusting, long-term relationships with clients and service providers, helps the client to identify/define needs and manages client/business expectations
Teamwork – Demonstrate evidence of being a strong team player, collaborates with others within and across teams, encourages other team members to participate and contribute and acknowledges others' contributions
Communication Skills - Communicates what is relevant and important in a clear and concise manner and shares information/new ideas with others
Judgement and Problem solving - Thinks ahead, anticipates questions, plans for contingencies, finds alternative solutions and identifies clear objectives. Sees the big picture and effectively analyses complex issues
Creativity/Innovation - Looks for new ways to improve current processes and develop creative solutions that are grounded in reality and have practical value
Influencing Outcomes - Presents sound, persuasive rationale for ideas or opinions. Takes a position on issues and influences others' opinions and presents persuasive recommendations

If you would like to understand how we will process your data
should you apply to Rothesay Life, information can be found here: https://www.rothesaylife.com/media/1324/april-2019-ja-pn.pdf

We're looking for an experienced, professional and enthusiastic business analyst to join a our team.

The purpose of the role:

The aim of the role is to understand, document and communicate business requirements in use case form, particularly in relation to user tools, so that the development team can deliver and maintain the resulting systems and technical solutions.

Success will be achieved by capturing, analysing and documenting requirements and then supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with stakeholders, seeking buy-in and agreement on technology changes.

The role requires a good knowledge of working in an agile development team delivering large-scale multi-tenanted web applications and APIs using use cases, TDD & BDD.

Responsibilities
Identify, analyse and document business processes & workflows. Identify opportunities for streamlining and improvements.
Comfortable communicating technical issues to stakeholders in a way that makes the business impact clear. Able to communicate project issues so there is an understanding of the problem and options for how it would be solved.
Facilitate decision making with the stakeholders, including engineers, web developers, project managers, UX designer and test engineer. This will include conversations about scope, about the detail of individual requirements and bigger picture approaches to the solution, and about providing clear options.
Work with the test engineer to support, facilitate, or execute acceptance tests, ensuring the delivered solution meets the business requirements and agreed quality criteria
With the Project Manager and technical leads, lead and facilitate the task breakdown and assessment of user stories.
Where appropriate gather, analyse, and report usage data or other such relevant data in support of measuring the performance of the product
Requirements

Skills and Requirements:
Substantial Business Analysis experience with a focus on requirements gathering and documentation, and story breakdown into tasks.
Experience working with multi-disciplinary teams in a new media software delivery environment.
Experience of working on online application projects and with relevant technologies, such as web-based (HTML5, JavaScript) front-ends on tiered, service-oriented architectures.
User story based requirements documenting for various audiences - both technical & non-technical
Demonstrable experience of using relevant documenting & diagramming techniques such as Use Cases, User Stories, User Journeys, and BDD.
Experience and understanding of agile development methodologies such as SCRUM and Kanban, and tools such as JIRA.
Understanding and experience of business analysis skills, techniques, and practices with an eye for detail.
Ability to simplify complex problems, processes or projects into component parts, explore and evaluate them systematically.
Experience working in a TDD/ BDD environment
Experience developing multi-tenanted SaaS products
Experience with user analytics such as Google Analytics
Experience of cloud-based development environments such as AWS

Business Analyst

We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to lead the business analysis efforts on a range of public services that are at the forefront of what technology. You will be expected to:
Work independently
Have an excellent understanding of business analysis
Sensitively elicit the needs and requirements of the organisation
Propose solutions
Contribute to the business analysis community with Agilisys
Manage stakeholder relationships
Be flexible on working location
Skills needed for this role

Agile working. You are experienced in working in cross functional or matrix teams consisting of a mix of people from the client and supplier. You can identify and compare the best processes or delivery methods to use, including measuring and evaluating outcomes. You know how to help the team to decide the best approach. You can help teams to manage and visualise outcomes, prioritise work and work to agreed scope. You have a working knowledge of the GDS Service Manual and can evangelise the benefits of Agile working.

Business analysis. You can take responsibility for investigative work into problems and opportunities in existing and new services. You know how to drive the analysis and collection of information to create recommendations for service improvements. You can analyse large amounts of complex information and use it to produce solutions. You can clearly describe a solution so that it is understandable by all members of a cross functional team.

Business improvement process. You know how to analyse current services and processes (these will often include offline processes as well as legacy technology systems) and can identify and implement opportunities to optimise these. You can lead others to create innovative solutions.

Business modelling. You can model more advanced and complex situations across more than one business function or programme. You know how to gather insight from senior stakeholders and communicate modelling results clearly to them.

Business Benefits. You can derive and model potential benefits from a solution and use this to create business cases.

Digital perspective. You can apply a deep understanding of digital solutions to your work. You can identify the limitations and solutions for those with limited skills or abilities with digital technologies.

Enterprise and business architecture. You can contribute to the creation and maintenance of the target operating model and identify the impact on operational service.

Methods and tools. You can select and support the right tools and methodologies within the common Agilisys business analysis framework and you can identify areas that require a more tailored approach. You can estimate and provide planning support on business analysis tasks. You can contribute to the business analysis community within Agilisys to improve processes.

Analysis techniques. You can develop and facilitate structured workshops with complex and resistant stakeholder dynamics. You can facilitate the setting of business priorities for change initiatives of high complexity and where there are competing needs.

Stakeholder relationship management. You have working experience of undertaking projects within the public sector, ideally local government. You can influence stakeholders and manage relationships effectively. You know how to build long-term strategic relationships and communicate clearly and regularly with stakeholders.

User focus. You know how to collaborate with user researchers and can represent users internally. You understand the difference between user needs and the desires of the user. You can champion user research to focus on all users. You can prioritise and define approaches to understand the user story, guiding others in doing so. You can offer recommendations on the best tools and methods to be used.

About Agilisys

Stemming from one of UK's leading digital venture builder, Agilisys is home to people that love solving complex problems and making change happen by having a passion for technology and digital disruption. As an Employee Owned business, our people are our main asset, and everyone has a real say in the direction that the business is heading.

In Customer Experience Management (CXM) practice, we work with our clients to design and deliver solutions that can involve creation of services and operating models, building business cases and the subsequent change programmes; undertaking whole system/service evaluations or delivering complex multi-partner implementations – no job is the same.

We bring an insightful, questioning and highly informed perspective and our people are driven by the quest to keep delivering next-generation business and digital solutions to solve our public and private sector clients' challenges.

Our Ethos

Agilisys' entrepreneurial roots mean that our people are our differentiator and as an agile business, you have influence and the opportunity to make a difference.

Benefits

We're based in our headquarters in Hammersmith (but moving to a brand new office in White City before the Summer of 2020. Most of our team spend a lot of their time onsite with our clients all over the UK and Channel Islands.

We offer flexible working and a great corporate benefits scheme:
Pension Scheme
Health Insurance
Being an Employee Owner as part of the EOT
Life Assurance
Flexible working

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst - EU Softlines Category Excellence
Job Description:
We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to join the Amazon Fashion finance team. Amazon Fashion's business is a dynamic and a key strategic focus area for the company. We need bright, talented people to help us fulfill our mission of making Amazon the most-loved fashion destination for our customers

The Senior Financial Analyst will work closely with multiple Pan EU teams within our Category Excellence organization such as Inventory, Management, Planning, Pricing and Promotions to become their trusted finance partner. In this role, you will drive and/or support various financial analyses and monitor operational plans that fuel Amazon's future growth. Expect to get involved in supporting strategic projects and help building plans for the future. You will also help transform and improve current finance and business processes as well as enable better decision making via higher transparency of financial results. The growth of the business and the increasing complexity make this role an exciting, interesting, and very challenging proposition with corresponding exposure to various senior stakeholders at Amazon. The role will be located in our corporate headquarter in London, United Kingdom.


The ideal candidate will be comfortable in in a high energy, entrepreneurial environment; will be a creative and analytical problem solver, who has an eye for details and strong inter-personal skills with the opportunity to fulfill the Amazon motto to "Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History".



Basic Qualifications


· A strong academic background; Finance or Accountancy qualification is preferred, an MBA may be considered
· Proven track record in financial planning and analysis and the management of related tasks (e.g. strategic planning, forecasting, reporting, variance analysis, business cases modelling, etc.)
· Advanced Excel essential, with VBA skills preferred
· Highly analytical, advanced problem solving skills, detail oriented without losing the big picture and strong business sense
· The ability to simplify and improve inefficient or unnecessarily complex processes.
· Results-oriented, highly energetic, dynamic individual with hands-on mentality
· Manage and prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, growing and ambiguous environment
· The ability to build positive business relationships and work collaboratively, across pan-EU, based on strong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
· An eye for detail and a passion for data & technology

Preferred Qualifications


· Prior knowledge of SQL/ETL would be beneficial, a willingness to learn this essential skill.
· Finance experience from Retail or FMCG companies within an international environment.

HR Analytics Sr Analyst

Equinix is one of the fastest growing data center companies, growing connectivity between clients worldwide. That’s why we're always looking for creative and forward thinking people who can help us achieve our goal of global interconnection. With 200 data centers in over 24 countries spanning across 5 continents, we are home to the Cloud, supporting over 1000 Cloud and IT services companies that are directly engaged in technological innovation and development. We are passionate about further evolving the specific areas of software development, software and network architecture, network operations and complex cloud and application solutions.

At Equinix, we make the internet work faster, better, and more reliably. We hire talented people who thrive on solving hard problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, try new approaches, and grow in new directions. Our culture is at the heart of our success and it’s our authentic, humble, gritty people who create The Magic of Equinix. We share a real passion for winning and put the customer at the center of everything we do.

The HR team is looking for a growth mindset-oriented HR Analytics Senior Analyst to help us build our reporting, data insight and predictive analytics capabilities. This role will work closely with HR Leaders to unlock insights through employee data.

In this role, you will develop data structures, analytics, and data visualizations that enable us to find insights and take action. You will partner with Equinix’s Talent Acquisition, Talent Management, Workforce Planning and Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging Teams.

Equinix is seeing unprecedented growth and the HR team over the next 12-24 months is making significant investments in HR systems and supporting data analytic tools and capabilities. The role is ideal for someone that is a problem solver and problem identifier, who is looking to grow their analytics capabilities. The successful candidate will have strong quantitative skills and can effectively convey complex concepts to non-analytical people.

Responsibilities
Partner closely with Senior Leadership, HR Business Partners, HR colleagues in other functional areas and fellow analytics team members to identify key workforce issues impacting the business.
Use consulting skills to determine and articulate internal customer business questions, develop the best approach for data analysis and turn data into actionable insights & recommendations.
Participate in HR analytics projects to investigate potential measures, correlations and causality connections for critical business issues
Merge structured, semi-structured and unstructured data from several systems to highlight company trends related to recruiting, developing, engaging and retaining talent
Develop hypotheses, document assumptions, and analyze results as they relate to key business initiatives.
Explore and analyze the data creatively to identify HR analytics solutions that add value in the strategic decision-making process.
Prediction and trend analysis to anticipate the changes in the business, and to enable better decision making.
Effectively communicate statistical analyses, results, and implications to technical and non-technical audiences.
Deliver high quality analysis, reports, presentations using simple and effective visualizations that can be scaled for consumption by a larger audience.
Create and maintain monthly and quarterly workforce dashboards. Develop processes to streamline the compilation of periodic reporting/analysis.
Create advanced models in excel to combine data sources and steer business decisions.
Work with HRIS to perform reconciliations and audits of HR data to ensure data integrity.
Qualifications
3+ years of relevant work experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to influence business stakeholders and drive change
Strong analytical, numerical and IT skills
Previous experience of Workday is advantageous but not essential
Excellent attention to detail
Excellent quantitative skills, including data manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization
Advanced MS Excel skills
Proficiency in tools such as R and Tableau are a strong plus
Experience in the analytics spaces within the HR function is preferred
Strong business acumen, including understanding of basic business and financial concepts
Possesses natural curiosity and thinks outside the box
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Data Science, or relevant engineering discipline preferred
Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Company Overview


At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.


Department Overview
Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team is responsible for analysis of financial reports, trends, risks and opportunities. We gather, interpret and evaluate financial information, including past financial data and short- to long-term financial forecasts. FP&A department supports wide range of Motorola Solutions businesses and operations functions across International region (EMEA, APAC and LATAM).

Job Description


Your responsibility will include performing analysis of MSI Technologies P&Ls, forecasting, variance analysis and working with regional financial controllers to ensure alignment with P&L plan and forecasts. Analyst on this role will have to quickly understand existing process and work on their improvements and automation.

Responsibilities of the Senior Financial Analyst:
Prepare analysis of P&Ls (revenue and margins) explaining variances to plan, previous forecast and actual results by technology
Work with pre-sales controllers on contribution margin inputs
Calculate gross margins by business segment, by technology and by country
Support creation of the corporate reporting package for all the technologies for International markets
Ensuring Plan and forecasts per technology are loaded to the system and are reasonable
Provide detailed product analysis to various business teams
Support the planned process improvements and automations (cooperation with IT and Tableau team including design stage, testing and verification of the solution in production)

Basic Requirements


Key Qualifications of the Senior Financial Analyst:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting
Experience working in Finance / Accounting / Business Support role
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work under time pressure
Good communication skills, ability to interact with Finance/Sales ops people at various level
Strong system skills in Excel, Oracle and Essbase are a plus

Travel Requirements

Relocation Provided

Position Type
Referral Payment Plan
Yes

Today, with over 500 consultants deployed on client sites globally and presence in London, New York, Paris, Singapore, Johannesburg, Montreal and Hong Kong, we’re a trusted partner to global organisations committed to upscaling their tech teams and deliver innovative technology services.

Are you an experienced Senior Data Analyst looking to take responsibility in a fast-growing Fintech scale up in London? If so, we would love to speak to you!

Our data analysis team are responsible for identifying and solving problems across Oodle's lending platform and use data to help handle and drive the rapid growth of our application pipeline. They are the go-to people for data-driven answers to the most pressing questions the business can ask.

BAU Operations Analyst


Role title: BAU Operations
Analyst

Reports to: Operations
Manager

Contract:

Permanent

Operations - Divisional Overview

The Operations division is an integral part of the independent control
and support structure whose key mandate is to establish and maintain an
effective control environment. Robust control and risk management drives our
business.

Operations strategy is underpinned by 3 guiding principles:

=
Payments: Pay our policyholders, Trustees and counterparties accurately
and on time, within regulatory guidelines

=
Policyholders: Follow the Regulator’s Treating Customers Fairly (TCF)
guidance and ensure a best-in-class policyholder experience

=
Data: Maintain accurate and complete data for risk and capital
management

These 3 principles drive our processes and controls, and are essential
for protecting our reputation, managing our risk and capital position, and
managing our Third Party Administrators (TPAs).

General activities of the Operations team include:

• Act
as an independent control over transactions of the Business

• Trade
capture and risk mitigation to ensure bookings are an accurate reflection of
business risk

• Execution
and management of lifecycle events

• Support
of project teams in department-wide initiatives

• Development
of technology infrastructure to support the risk management and processing
capabilities of transactions

• Close
data analysis and reconciliations involving breaking down and data manipulation

The Operations BAU Team is responsible for ensuring all operational
requirements across our Liability and Reinsurance contracts are serviced
correctly. This role will suit a person who is enthusiastic, ambitious and
hard-working, who has a desire to work in a fast-paced and demanding
environment, who can work independently as well as being part of a small team,
and who is able to communicate effectively and demonstrate initiative. It is
key that the candidate understands the role that Operations plays in a
financial services firm. The candidate must possess an analytical mind-set
where they are able to formulate processes that achieve the required
controls.

The position available gives the candidate a lot of autonomy and it is
important that they are self-driven to deliver against targets whilst managing
time and expectations independently. The role would ideally suit a
graduate or an analyst with 1-2 years’ work experience.

Responsibilities:

=
Complete a range of daily control activities which include ensuring
front to back data flows are accurate, trade capture is correct and
payments/funding occur accurately and on time

=
Execution and management of lifecycle events such as routine data
cleanses

=
Monitor accuracy of liability and reinsurance data being maintained by
TPAs which ultimately drives the P/L for the business. This is done through
data reconciliations and the use of exception reporting

=
Work with our TPAs to ensure operational service is delivered accurately
and per SLA. This will involve resolving queries and working with our
TPAs to refine and build process improvements

=
Reporting of key risk metrics to management

=
Perform a number of data reconciliations, analysing results and seeing
issues through to completion

=
Continuous process improvement is key in this growth business and
supporting projects and technology change is a function of this role

Skills & Experience:

Required:

=
Minimum 2:1 degree from a leading university (please note strong
candidates with exceptional work experience will also be considered should the
degree criteria not be met)

=
Demonstrable ability to manage multiple projects, tasks and own
workload, whilst remaining focused on operational risks

=
Ability to demonstrate collaborative working practises, soliciting
feedback from others on work and ideas

=
Ability to think about the big picture and deliver above and beyond core
functions

=
Accuracy and absolute attention to detail

=
Strong communication skills to clearly articulate status and issues to
others

Preferred:

=
Strong MS Excel / VBA skills

=
Some pensions, insurance and/or reinsurance knowledge

=
Ability to work with complex documentation and identify operational
controls

=
Experience supervising or managing individuals

=
Understanding of risk controls in an operational environment, including
knowledge of RCSAs

Worldpay is the global leader in the payments industry. Our client base includes some of the largest online retail merchants operating in the global economy. Operating as a commercial business partner, you will conduct pricing analysis providing recommendations on market conditions to support and contribute to the e-commerce strategy.
You will conduct profitability, price sensitivity, risk and scenario analysis and work on opportunities for price optimisation. You will carry out pricing projects and initiatives to generate incremental revenue for the business.
You will support the sales force in assisting with their queries on pricing policy and the pricing model

Since 2010, we’ve helped organisations deliver key technology projects with expert consultancy across risk and compliance, application support and software development, vendor products and cyber and information security.
This is underpinned by our 24-month Alumni Graduate Programme, which bridges the gap between academic life and corporate culture by helping talented graduates build on formal qualifications with technology training and career coaching that prepares them for a fast-paced start to their career with our client base.
Today, with over 500 consultants deployed on client sites globally and presence in London, New York, Paris, Singapore, Johannesburg, Montreal and Hong Kong, we’re a trusted partner to global organisations committed to upscaling their tech teams and deliver innovative technology services.

MThree supports graduate development at all levels irrespective of gender, race, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation. MThree is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and runs regular diversity events and initiatives to attract the best graduate talent spanning all backgrounds.

Are you an experienced Senior Data Analyst looking to take responsibility in a fast-growing Fintech scale up in London? If so, we would love to speak to you!

Our data analysis team are responsible for identifying and solving problems across Oodle's lending platform and use data to help handle and drive the rapid growth of our application pipeline. They are the go-to people for data-driven answers to the most pressing questions the business can ask.

Building models to forecast business performance.

Hands-on experience and expertise with data analysis
Interpersonal skills as you'll engage with colleagues across all levels of the business to understand and solve their challenges

Python
SQL

Salesforce
Version control e.g. Git
Financial services experience

We are a fun and outgoing team who all sit in a startup office in Oxford Street, London. We value getting our hands dirty and waste no time as we bid to change the used-car industry. Oodle Car Finance is changing the way people buy cars by putting our customers' needs front and centre of the second biggest retail market in the UK. When you join Oodle, you directly input on how we develop and how we change the game.

BAU Operations Analyst


Role title: BAU Operations
Analyst

Reports to: Operations
Manager

Contract:

Permanent

Operations - Divisional Overview

The Operations division is an integral part of the independent control
and support structure whose key mandate is to establish and maintain an
effective control environment. Robust control and risk management drives our
business.

Operations strategy is underpinned by 3 guiding principles:

=
Payments: Pay our policyholders, Trustees and counterparties accurately
and on time, within regulatory guidelines

=
Policyholders: Follow the Regulator’s Treating Customers Fairly (TCF)
guidance and ensure a best-in-class policyholder experience

=
Data: Maintain accurate and complete data for risk and capital
management

These 3 principles drive our processes and controls, and are essential
for protecting our reputation, managing our risk and capital position, and
managing our Third Party Administrators (TPAs).

General activities of the Operations team include:

• Act
as an independent control over transactions of the Business

• Trade
capture and risk mitigation to ensure bookings are an accurate reflection of
business risk

• Execution
and management of lifecycle events

• Support
of project teams in department-wide initiatives

• Development
of technology infrastructure to support the risk management and processing
capabilities of transactions

• Close
data analysis and reconciliations involving breaking down and data manipulation

The Operations BAU Team is responsible for ensuring all operational
requirements across our Liability and Reinsurance contracts are serviced
correctly. This role will suit a person who is enthusiastic, ambitious and
hard-working, who has a desire to work in a fast-paced and demanding
environment, who can work independently as well as being part of a small team,
and who is able to communicate effectively and demonstrate initiative. It is
key that the candidate understands the role that Operations plays in a
financial services firm. The candidate must possess an analytical mind-set
where they are able to formulate processes that achieve the required
controls.

The position available gives the candidate a lot of autonomy and it is
important that they are self-driven to deliver against targets whilst managing
time and expectations independently. The role would ideally suit a
graduate or an analyst with 1-2 years’ work experience.

Responsibilities:

=
Complete a range of daily control activities which include ensuring
front to back data flows are accurate, trade capture is correct and
payments/funding occur accurately and on time

=
Execution and management of lifecycle events such as routine data
cleanses

=
Monitor accuracy of liability and reinsurance data being maintained by
TPAs which ultimately drives the P/L for the business. This is done through
data reconciliations and the use of exception reporting

=
Work with our TPAs to ensure operational service is delivered accurately
and per SLA. This will involve resolving queries and working with our
TPAs to refine and build process improvements

=
Reporting of key risk metrics to management

=
Perform a number of data reconciliations, analysing results and seeing
issues through to completion

=
Continuous process improvement is key in this growth business and
supporting projects and technology change is a function of this role

Skills & Experience:

Required:

=
Minimum 2:1 degree from a leading university (please note strong
candidates with exceptional work experience will also be considered should the
degree criteria not be met)

=
Demonstrable ability to manage multiple projects, tasks and own
workload, whilst remaining focused on operational risks

=
Ability to demonstrate collaborative working practises, soliciting
feedback from others on work and ideas

=
Ability to think about the big picture and deliver above and beyond core
functions

=
Accuracy and absolute attention to detail

=
Strong communication skills to clearly articulate status and issues to
others

Preferred:

=
Strong MS Excel / VBA skills

=
Some pensions, insurance and/or reinsurance knowledge

=
Ability to work with complex documentation and identify operational
controls

=
Experience supervising or managing individuals

=
Understanding of risk controls in an operational environment, including
knowledge of RCSAs

As an Analyst within the Group Treasury Capital Management team, you’ll help us report to the Chief Financial Officer and manage the Group's capital position. The team is largely focused on building Capital strategies for the Group and performing regular and ad-hoc reporting to the CFO.

As part of this small, specialised team, you will be given the opportunity to gain broad exposure to the activities of Macquarie divisions operating in the region and to build close relationships with these businesses and other support functions.

Your key responsibilities will include:
the production and coordination of the ICAAP summary documents including project planning and dealing with stakeholders across a wide variety of teams within Macquarie
supporting in the capital management of regulated entities, including maintenance of framework documentation, monitoring developments in UK and European prudential standards, impact analysis, monitoring and oversight
review business proposals in the region to help identify and address the impact on capital requirements for local entities and liaise within the team and other support functions to ensure these are considered for regulatory reporting and capital management purposes.
Your experience will include:
the ability to understand and evaluate regulatory rules and apply them effectively
being aware of current UK and EU prudential regime for credit institutions and investment firms, including Basel, CRD / CRR, and the Pillar 2 / ICAAP framework in Europe and the UK
a willingness to understand Australian prudential regulatory regimes
organised and able to collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders
communication skills both written and verbal and promoting a strong compliance culture
· the ability to think critically and conceptualize abstract ideas
the ability to work to tight deadlines and manage projects with multiple dependencies.
If this sounds like your next role, we look forward to hearing from you.

What you’ll do day-to-day


The analyst will be an integral part of the investment team responsible for analyzing, structuring, closing, and monitoring investments within our deal teams. Job Description:
Your opportunity
The Deloitte Global Cybersecurity function is responsible for the firm’s overall objectives of enhancing data protection, standardizing and securing critical infrastructure and gaining cyber visibility through security operations centers. The Cybersecurity organization delivers a comprehensive set of cybersecurity services to Deloitte member firms through regional delivery hubs and a Global Fusion Center. We are seeking a Firewall Analyst to join the team.
We are proud to offer flexible working arrangements which allow our people to choose the most suitable working arrangement that works for them. Whether this is working 4 days per week, taking the summer months off work, or more flexibility around your working pattern, we consider both formal and informal working arrangements that allow our people and our clients the best outcome.
If you would like to hear more about our flexible working arrangements, please let us know.

Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.

Your role
The Technical Delivery Analyst role reports to the Manager of the Technical Delivery team of Firewall Management Services. The role focuses on providing support and management to the delivery of the Firewall Management Service. The position works closely with the Architecture, Engineering, and Operations teams responsible for 24x7 firewall support to the Deloitte member firms.

Responsibilities:
•Provide technical delivery support for firewalls across the Deloitte global infrastructure.
•Assist in the planning, implementation, and deploying of security infrastructure components.
•Ensure standard features of the Firewall Management Service are deployed to the firewall landscape, such as monitoring, capacity planning, and inventory control.
•Provide visibility and insight to assist customers with firewall assets, contracts, cost-control measures.
•Follow through with firm and vendor resources to close out tasks that involve firewalls in any Deloitte location.
•Pursue quotes, reconcile costs, and track delivery of hardware and software throughout the delivery process.
•Assist in finance and budget coordination.
•Be accountable for executing tasks according to established standards, procedures, and processes.
•Be able to communicate and work with customers and peers in different time zones and countries.
•Provide excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to easily analyze and communicate complex ideas to all levels of management.
•Be responsible for awareness and compliance to policy and guidelines.
•Report, pursue, communicate, and when needed escalate any breaches in information security or policies.
•Be able to coordinate and work with on-site resources during outage or critical situations.
•Adhere to established incident management SLA and SLOs.
•Be able to document processes and procedures for the collaboration with the team.
•Provide input into peer performance reviews.
•Mentor staff on technical processes and procedures.
•Contribute to, produce, and maintain technical documentation
•Ensure compliance with processes and adherence to documented standards.
•Assist in training new staff in technical processes and procedures.

Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location:
You will be based at our London office, with an option of working from home one day a week.
Work pattern:
This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role can be worked on a full-time basis. Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we’ll try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
•Bachelor’s Degree/College Diploma in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
•Combined experience in Information Technology
•Professional security management certification from vendors is desirable, such as Check Point, Palo Alto Networks, and Cisco.
•Industry wide certification, such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or other similar credentials are favorable.
•Ability to work well with team members in a globally diverse environment.
•Ability to analyze data sets for errors, omissions, and additions
•Knowledge of LAN/WAN and network protocols.
•Knowledge of monitoring tools.
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills required. Must be able to easily analyze and communicate complex ideas to all levels of management.
•Sensitivity and cultural awareness is essential as the role will interact with resources globally.
•Discipline and experience in recognizing and handling confidential and sensitive information.
•Excellent time management and attention to detail is essential.
•Knowledge of server technologies is a plus.
•Knowledge of virtual technologies is a plus.
•Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high pressure environment

Your service line: Deloitte Global
Across disciplines and across borders, Deloitte Global supports our network of member firms by developing and driving global strategy, programs, and platforms, and creating new solutions and transformational experiences. Deloitte Global professionals makes an impact that matters to the world of Deloitte. We share a passion for igniting change and a strong service orientation that shapes our organization and those it supports.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Malta, the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,500 partners and over 40,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.

Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

Acumen Solutions drives excellence - not only in our performance, but also in the results we deliver for our clients. We are a global cloud consultancy combining the insight of our strategists, the vision of our innovators, and the ingenuity of our engineers to achieve extraordinary impact. The Fortune 500 trust us to build solutions focused on growing revenue and profits by amplifying competitive advantage and strengthening customer relationships. Our groundbreaking solutions in the public sector streamline operations and improve productivity. We apply this same focus on excellence to our unparalleled social responsibility program, generating sustainable impact across our local communities. Engage with us at www.acumensolutions.com or on Twitter @AcumenSolutions.

Acumen Solutions is currently hiring Salesforce Business Analysts to join the team in our London, UK location.

Roles and Responsibilities

As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to Fortune 500 Companies and Government Agencies. Our Salesforce Business Analysts wear many hats on their projects and are responsible for everything from requirements gathering, Salesforce configuration, testing, training and post deployment support. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects and Technical Architects to design, develop, and deploy large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.

Key roles and responsibilities include:
Work with clients and end users to gather, understand, and define business requirements
Develop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions for our clients
Work collaboratively with team members to design a solution that will meet a client’s business requirements and fulfill user stories
Complete the configuration for user stories within Salesforce, AppExchange products, or other cloud-based technologies
Collaborate with developers to test and verify that solutions will meet the business requirements
Participate in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user training
Requirements
Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Products to develop client or business solutions
Hands on experience configuring Salesforce or similar CRM Product, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls
Proven ability leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast paced environment
Detail-oriented individual with the ability to quickly ramp up on new clients, their business needs, and technologies
Strong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skills
Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environment
Demonstrates flexibility and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done
Drive and desire to learn and grow both technical and functional skill sets
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio
Salesforce Admin Certification and one Consulting Cloud Certification (Sales, Service or Community)
Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent
Ability to travel up to 50%
Preferred Experience and Skills
Experience leveraging and configuring AppExchange products to develop a solution
Experience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirements
Experience documenting user stories and creating to-be process flow diagrams
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders
Experience on a Salesforce implementation through the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Benefits

Acumen Solutions offers the opportunity for growth and advancement, as well as a competitive base salary, annual performance based incentives, medical and pension schemes, income protection, holiday/sick leave, and more.

About Us

As a leading management and technology consulting firm, Acumen Solutions offers a range of challenging and rewarding opportunities whether you’re just starting out in your career, looking to advance your career, or seeking a senior leadership position. Acumen Solutions employees are ambitious, committed, passionate problem solvers.

Cisco Meraki knows that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free passionate people to focus on their mission. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you help customise the direction by ensuring our organizational challenges and opportunities are driving towards the best results.

We offer privately catered lunches every single day plus you can help yourself free of charge to our fully stocked kitchen at all times – from freshly squeezed orange juice and a huge array of fruit, to salads, salamis and cheese. If you’re looking for a company that really commits, how about our complimentary weekly yoga classes, sports societies, games room, or organised family days so you can bring your children into work? But what truly makes Meraki special are the people – people who keep the culture strong and make working here exciting, meaningful, and rewarding.

In this highly collaborative role, we will put your analytical skills to the test by building dynamic territory and revenue models to help build equitable sales patches. You will be relied on as the expert in sales territory planning, understanding the best ways to segment all of our EMEAR sales teams. You will be responsible for managing relationships with executive sales leadership while communicating with local sales management. Organization and attention to detail are key in this role, as is the ability to learn quickly and communicate effectively. Experience in a startup environment will serve you well, as you will be required to take on a variety of projects at a fast pace. You are looking to expand your analytical portfolio and are passionate about learning to enable your teammates into success.

You will:
Partner with sales management and become a trusted advisor. Do this by providing deep quantitative insights matched with thoughtful operational process that is based on understanding of key business drivers.
Build rep territory and segmentation models; act as primary advisor on sales coverage to Sales Leadership.
Produce & automate weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting; lend insight to the reporting.
Develop deep understanding for existing Sales and Sales Operations processes, including rep territory tools and lead routing of data management, forecasting, sales opportunities, dashboards and reports.
Partner with Sales Operations teams on developing process improvements to standardise, automate and optimise central processes in a scalable approach
Partner with Sales Strategy to help with quota setting and headcount planning process.
Use your past experience driving reporting, insights and analytical rigor to mentor teammates and develop peers.
Team-up with leadership to discover and build new planning and insights projects.
You are:

A curious, quick learner who adapts well to a fast-moving environment and keeps projects moving forward, combines creativity, problem-solving skills, and a can-do attitude to overcome any obstacle!
Energetic, personable, and comfortable working under tight deadlines.
You are a standout colleague who works collaboratively and effectively across a diverse set of functions, backgrounds, and working styles
You communicate broadly and often, providing clear purpose, direction, goals, and measures!
Able to Disagree, Decide, and Commit. You listen to understand different opinions and allow them to influence the direction.
Able to deal with complex problems and present recommendations and findings in a clear, concise format
Results Driven. You are resilient, optimistic, and passionate about our business results while never compromising customer, partner, and team relationships.
You commit to earning our team’s trust every day through your actions and transparency.
You have:

6+ years relevant experience in Sales Operations or other Sales Support functions, with specific experience in territory management and headcount strategy
Experience with Salesforce, particularly in reporting and hierarchy management.
Strong analytical experience in financial modeling and data analysis.
The ability to think globally and strategically
Past experience executing on strategic processes
Can prioritise tasks efficiently & solve problems independently.
High degree of attention to detail.
Solid understanding of sales and business processes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English plus another EMEAR language; you are comfortable making recommendations to sales leadership.
Understanding of EMEAR geography and differences between its sub-regions. Familiarity with complexities caused by sales cycles in different countries.
Demonstrated ability to build collaborative relationships with other departments.
A good sense of humor.
Strong experience in Excel; SQL and technical aspects of data a strong plus.
A bachelor’s degree.
