Job Title: Office of the CAO | Reference Data, Project Manager/Business Analyst
Job Description:
Job Description

The Team:


We are looking for leaders and problem solvers who are passionate about data and data management.

The purpose of the Project Management/Business Analyst (PM/BA) role within the Reference Data Operations team is to independently evaluate business requirements and recommend solutions in support of a reference data universe that spans Citadel’s global footprint. The role requires effective management of both short term, tactical solutions as well as longer term, multi-quarter strategic initiatives.

A successful candidate will be a proficient PM/BA who communicates and collaborates effectively, taking ownership and accountability for all aspects of each project assigned to them. They will manage requests throughout their life-cycle from business analysis, to prioritization, to collaboration with technical counterparts, through to delivery and business acceptance. The ability to work across a wide range of stakeholders; business and technical, internal and external is central to the role.

Responsibilities:

Reporting to the PM/BA Lead, the PM/BA will evaluate current tactical issues, lead small/mid-size initiatives, and contribute to enterprise-wide strategic initiatives.
Work with front and back office stakeholders across the organization to design and deliver comprehensive reference data solutions across a wide range of asset classes, geographies, and instrument types.
Assist in management front/middle office requests to development teams to ensure concepts are properly evaluated, implemented, and risk assessed.
Evaluate systems for opportunities to automate with focus on highest return on investment.
Help design and implement metrics for tracking product and operational health.
Manage tracks within larger strategic initiatives.
Work with stakeholders within the organization to refine and improve knowledge and processes.
Design and implement processes that facilitate the use and administration of reference data.
Required Skills
5 or more years of professional experience in financial services, particularly reference data or technology
Extensive product knowledge across a broad array of financial products and Instruments
Experience supporting data integration, data governance, data life cycle management, data quality, and data strategy
Strong analytical, quantitative skills
Project Management and Business Analysis experience
Experience in developing metrics (Tableau preferred)
Python, SQL, or similar for data analysis and tool building (preferred)
Education: BA/BS Bachelor’s Degree (STEM degree preferred)

About Citadel


Citadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For a quarter of a century, Citadel’s hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.

With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel’s team of more than 675 investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.
Competitors: Soros Fund Management, D. E. Shaw & Co. - Investment Firm, Fortress Investment Group

Job Description:
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

The Financial Institutions Data Specialist role will be part of the Global Content Operations (GCO) organization, and will interface with teams across GCO, as well as other areas of Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions.

The data specialist will be a key component in Fitch's objective to strengthen our banking, insurance and non-banking financial institutions information, and will be highly influential in helping to shape our future direction, to meet the needs of clients for high quality, complete, accurate and timely data.

The role will require the candidate to analyse and interpret financial information across sectors, providing guidance to analysts on policies and procedures, designed to standardise the information as it is collected within Fitch templates. The candidate will also be involved in projects around automation as Fitch looks at ways to make the collection if data more efficient. The role involves close collaboration with the data analysis team, for the purposes of quality assurance, policy adherence and policy development. The role reports in to the Head of Financial Institutions Content.

Responsibilities:
Participating in regular meetings with Fitch ratings analysts to align goals and objectives for data representation
Ensure highest levels of data quality for banks, insurers and non-banking financial institutions, checking data has been correctly processed by the analysts and providing feedback when required
Initiate improvements to data support processes and procedures, by creating policies, and maintaining best practice documents for use in training and overall data capture process
Provide advice on modifications to data entry templates needed to reflect evolving analytical or industry circumstances
Actively participating in external client meetings, providing presentations to promote the Fitch product
Providing support to the Head of Financial Institutions Content and Financial Institutions Data Team Leader
Prepare and provide regular reporting to stakeholders about bank financial data
Qualifications and Experience:
Experience of working with fundamental data, in a accountancy, actuarial or auditing environment, with an understanding of IFRS, GAAP & wider accounting fundamental processes
A CIMA, ACCA, ACA qualified or part qualified candidate would be preferred
Excellent administration and communication skills
Proven experience of interacting effectively with senior management
Experience of working with offshore or outsourcing teams is highly sought
Must have a highly organised and methodical approach to work
To be a self-starter who can pick up new processes quickly and accurately
Have the ability to work within a team environment
Have a can-do attitude to problems
Sound knowledge of a second language would be an advantage
#LI-TD1

#LI-Solutions

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.

For more information about this policy, please visit the Code of Ethics and Conduct page.
Competitors: Moody's Corporation, Bloomberg L.P., S&P Global Ratings

Job Description:
Company Description

Full-time

Company Description

Colliers International is a leading commercial real estate services company, providing a full range of services to real estate occupiers, developers and investors on a local, national and international basis. Services include brokerage sales and leasing (landlord and tenant representation), real estate management, valuation, consulting, project management, project marketing and research. We provide our services across the core sectors (office, industrial, retail and hotel) as well as many specialised property types.

Through advanced transaction advisory and execution services, our Corporate Capital Solutions (CCS) team leverages its diverse expertise in real estate strategy, capital markets, corporate finance and accounting, to create bespoke capital solutions which best suit the short, medium and long term financial and operational objectives of our corporate clients.

CCS provide services in the areas of strategy, acquisitions, divestments, M&A, build-to-suit, purchase and sale to leaseback, corporate and structured finance and major lease projects.

Following significant success across 2019 and as part of our strategic objective to recruit the very best talent, we are seeking for a Senior Analyst at an associate director level to join the team here at Colliers

Job Description

The main responsibilities of this role will include, but will not be limited to:
Leading capital markets transactions from strategy to completion across multiple asset classes and geographies throughout EMEA;
Predicting long/short-term performance of commercial investment opportunities and advising clients on long and medium-term performance of potential and current investments across their EMEA interests;
Reporting the implications of long-term investment opportunities, utilising external and internal data and communicating them clearly to all stakeholders, facilitators and partners via presentations and the use of excel and appropriate software as required;
Preparing pro forma models for all potential acquisitions and relevant deals, as assigned by the Directors and clients where appropriate
Keeping up to date with financial products, legislation and requirements for compliance with the relevant regulatory authority.
Creating and managing bespoke financial models in Excel adopting best practice techniques including both cash and P&L analysis;
Analysing and underwriting investment and development opportunities;
Attending client meetings as required and presenting financial outputs in a clear and concise manner;
Bringing an innovative approach to enhance our best practice processes; and
Managing client relationships and generating new business opportunities
Key Skills
Advanced capabilities in Excel and developing bespoke complex IRR, EM, DCF and P&L models
High quality presentation skills in PPT
Understanding of corporate balance sheet and P&L as well as investment and development sectors
In depth knowledge of capital markets and deal structuring involving funds, developers and private equity
Understanding of debt and equity throughout the capital stack and how to maximise returns
Be able to work well as part of a team as well as independently
Strong interpersonal skills, able to create and eager to develop effective relationships with stakeholders and fellow team members within the EMEA capital markets function
Thrive working to deadlines within a fast-paced environment.
Qualifications

Qualifications and experience

Real estate investment or finance qualification, CFA level 1-3 would be beneficial

Additional Information

Salary: £65,000 - £75,000 per year, depending on experience

Posting date: 6th March 2020

Closing date: 3rd April 2020

Brambles companies, including CHEP, help move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organisation on earth. Our 330 million pallets, crates and containers are continuously in motion, forming the invisible backbone of the global supply chain and the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, sustainably and safely. As pioneers of the sharing economy, Brambles created one of the world's most sustainable logistics businesses through the share and reuse of its platforms under a model known as ‘pooling’. Brambles primarily serves the fast-moving consumer goods (e.g. dry food, grocery, and health and personal care), fresh produce, beverage, retail and general manufacturing industries. The Group employs more than 10,000 people and operates in over 60 countries with its largest operations in North America and Western Europe. For further information, please visit www.brambles.com

Brambles and CHEP provide you unparalleled opportunities to advance and accelerate your career. You’ll be joining an international growth organization with a pioneering, circular business model. You’ll be working for a company that is changing the way goods get to market. You’ll become part of an efficient and collaborative global team making a real contribution to a smarter, more sustainable future. For more on how Brambles growth companies can accelerate your career, visit https://careers.brambles.com/

Position Description

This role will be part of the Group FP&A function reporting into the Senior Group FP&A Manager and will be dedicated to supporting the global finance project, Planning & Performance Management (PPM). The role will be involved in the end to end process to implement a newly procured global financial planning and reporting system, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

This role will support the project’s business and change management workstreams. The role will be heavily involved in supporting the on-boarding of PPM system users through testing, training, deployment, hyper-care, adoption and hand-over to the Sustainment Function as the project exits and enters business as usual. Stakeholder management and understanding FP&A processes is also a key part of role.

This role will require working closely with the Business Functional work stream and other key stakeholders, including FP&A teams across the Group.

Major / Key Accountabilities

Co-ordinating training programmes across all Business Units through local training leads/Super users.
Producing training material for end users using various channels, including videos, written manuals, online tests and webcasts.
Support the analysis of existing financial reports and planning process across Business Units versus the proposed PPM design in order to assist in the gap analysis and change impact assessment.
Tracking and reporting project cost against budget.
Managing the project SharePoint site and Yammer group, ensuring content is up to date and co-ordinating scheduled updates within the project team.
Managing the project Microsoft Teams site which is used as the formal document sharing platform with the external implementation partner. Requires closely liaising with the implementation team to ensure content is up to date and relevant.
Maintain the stakeholder effort register which provides a projection of the level of Subject Matter Experts (SME) participation required over time for the project to support resource planning.
Monitoring and updating the project success metrics scorecard for tracking project progress and assessing adoption of the new system.
Train to be a Super user for the PPM system to support the central project team in testing the PPM system prior to official System Integration Testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) phases of the project.
Capture and analyse outputs from workshops and assessment questionnaires then articulate these in a summarised format for the Project Leadership Team and key decision makers.
Summarise communication and feedback from SMEs and key stakeholders during the project, such as gathering design requirements and survey feedback.
Responsible for co-ordinating and facilitating project meetings and workshops, liaising with the implementation partner and internal stakeholders.
Support the Project Leadership Team with co-ordinating ad-hoc activities and analysis as required.
Experience
FP&A experience in both performance reporting and planning processes, preferably in multi-time zone, multi-currency, multi-cultural environments.
Project experience desirable either as a SME or as part of a core project team, ideally with implementing and managing software applications (e.g. participating in design workshops, change impact assessments, progress reporting, testing, go-live and adoption/BAU).
Qualifications
Graduate qualified in finance, business or economics
Part-qualified or newly qualified accountant – ACA / ACCA / CIMA / CA / CPA or equivalent
We're excited you're here to learn how we'll leverage our family of growth companies to accelerate your career. Brambles companies employ more than 14,500 people in over 60 countries, committed to connecting people to life's essentials, every day. Our people are shaping a smarter, more sustainable future by changing the way business makes, moves and sells goods in every corner of the world. We look forward to helping you become one of them. HTTPS://careers.brambles.com/

Cisco Meraki knows that technology can connect us, empower us, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free passionate people to focus on their mission. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you help customise the direction by ensuring our organizational challenges and opportunities are driving towards the best results.

We offer privately catered lunches every single day plus you can help yourself free of charge to our fully stocked kitchen at all times – from freshly squeezed orange juice and a huge array of fruit, to salads, salamis and cheese. If you’re looking for a company that really commits, how about our complimentary weekly yoga classes, sports societies, games room, or organised family days so you can bring your children into work? But what truly makes Meraki special are the people – people who keep the culture strong and make working here exciting, meaningful, and rewarding.

In this highly collaborative role, we will put your analytical skills to the test by building dynamic territory and revenue models to help build equitable sales patches. You will be relied on as the expert in sales territory planning, understanding the best ways to segment all of our EMEAR sales teams. You will be responsible for managing relationships with executive sales leadership while communicating with local sales management. Organization and attention to detail are key in this role, as is the ability to learn quickly and communicate effectively. Experience in a startup environment will serve you well, as you will be required to take on a variety of projects at a fast pace. You are looking to expand your analytical portfolio and are passionate about learning to enable your teammates into success.

You will:
Partner with sales management and become a trusted advisor. Do this by providing deep quantitative insights matched with thoughtful operational process that is based on understanding of key business drivers.
Build rep territory and segmentation models; act as primary advisor on sales coverage to Sales Leadership.
Produce & automate weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting; lend insight to the reporting.
Develop deep understanding for existing Sales and Sales Operations processes, including rep territory tools and lead routing of data management, forecasting, sales opportunities, dashboards and reports.
Partner with Sales Operations teams on developing process improvements to standardise, automate and optimise central processes in a scalable approach
Partner with Sales Strategy to help with quota setting and headcount planning process.
Use your past experience driving reporting, insights and analytical rigor to mentor teammates and develop peers.
Team-up with leadership to discover and build new planning and insights projects.
You are:

A curious, quick learner who adapts well to a fast-moving environment and keeps projects moving forward, combines creativity, problem-solving skills, and a can-do attitude to overcome any obstacle!
Energetic, personable, and comfortable working under tight deadlines.
You are a standout colleague who works collaboratively and effectively across a diverse set of functions, backgrounds, and working styles
You communicate broadly and often, providing clear purpose, direction, goals, and measures!
Able to Disagree, Decide, and Commit. You listen to understand different opinions and allow them to influence the direction.
Able to deal with complex problems and present recommendations and findings in a clear, concise format
Results Driven. You are resilient, optimistic, and passionate about our business results while never compromising customer, partner, and team relationships.
You commit to earning our team’s trust every day through your actions and transparency.
You have:

6+ years relevant experience in Sales Operations or other Sales Support functions, with specific experience in territory management and headcount strategy
Experience with Salesforce, particularly in reporting and hierarchy management.
Strong analytical experience in financial modeling and data analysis.
The ability to think globally and strategically
Past experience executing on strategic processes
Can prioritise tasks efficiently & solve problems independently.
High degree of attention to detail.
Solid understanding of sales and business processes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English plus another EMEAR language; you are comfortable making recommendations to sales leadership.
Understanding of EMEAR geography and differences between its sub-regions. Familiarity with complexities caused by sales cycles in different countries.
Demonstrated ability to build collaborative relationships with other departments.
A good sense of humor.
Strong experience in Excel; SQL and technical aspects of data a strong plus.
A bachelor’s degree.
Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.

Job Title : Lead Business Functional Analyst

Location : London

Corporate Title : Vice President

Our Anti Financial Crime (AFC) Technology team are working with cutting-edge technology to transform the way that we work. You’ll be working on innovative projects involving Artificial Intelligence (AI), sophisticated entity resolution and next-generation data interpretation capabilities to help detect, investigate and prevent financial crime activities in the global marketplace.

What we’ll offer you

A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its centre.

You can expect:
Competitive salary and non-contributory pension
30 days’ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase additional days
Life Assurance and Private Healthcare for you and your family
A range of flexible benefits including Retail Discounts, a Bike4Work scheme and Gym benefits
The opportunity to support a wide ranging CSR programme + 2 days’ volunteering leave per year

Your key responsibilities

Performing Product Owner capabilities for AI, entity resolution and data-related projects in Anti Financial Crime
Manage a team responsible for producing high quality requirement specifications using agile ways of working
Providing the functional design of AFC solutions in accordance with the defined principles, blueprints, standards, patterns, and controls
Collaborating with engineers, Quality Assurance Testers and business users to help implement world class AFC applications
Driving the Product Owner Practice as an expert in order to deliver continuous Improvement initiatives through Community of practice engagements

Your skills and experience

Agile experience in performing the product owner role in activities such as creating product backlogs, user stories and supporting sprint planning
Experience in heading up a team and working with business requirements through to system level Functional Specifications, using methods and be able to incorporate agile ways of working (e.g. Jama, Jira, HP ALM)
Good problem solving experience and ability to provide insights and solutions, with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Extensive experience in delivering technical and/or operational solutions in AFC in the Financial Services Industry
Educated to Bachelor’s degree level or equivalent qualification/relevant work experience (in Computer Science would be beneficial)

How we’ll support you

Training and development to help you excel in your career
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs

About us and our teams

Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.

Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

Do you have a 2:1 STEM degree, a genuine passion for technology and top-notch communication skills?

At mthree we help you turn your degree into a career – and we’re on the hunt for tomorrow's top production support analysts.

Are you…
A keen problem solver with an interest in technology
A people person who loves to communicate and collaborate to get the job done
Cool, calm and collected under pressure
A numbers whizz with an analytical mind
A go-getter with bags of enthusiasm
Someone who loves learning and developing new skills?
If so, let’s talk.

Our 24-month graduate programme pairs people just like you with our global banking clients, fast-tracking your development and turning your degree into a career. Beginning with 4-8 weeks of intensive training and career coaching at our London Canary Wharf Training Academy, the mthree Alumni Programme gives you everything you need to kick start a career in technology.

What you’ll learn:
The ins and outs of financial markets, trading and banking businesses
How to work in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities
The processes within banking
Information security and technology risk management policies
All you need to know about Linux, SQL and scripting.
What we offer:
Fully-paid, in-depth and interactive training with graduates just like you, delivered by experts with working knowledge of the field
A competitive salary, with:
Regular pay reviews
A flexible benefits package including gym membership
Ongoing training and pastoral care throughout the 24-month programme
Invaluable industry experience and the opportunity to start a career in a desirable and competitive sector.
What you’ll do:

Production support is a vital role within enterprise technology. Working with a global team, you’ll help support systems including algorithmic trading engines and regulatory reporting by:
Monitoring system health
Resolving incidents
Investigating past incidents
Managing the release process for new versions of software
Automating and enhancing workflows
Working closely with business stakeholders to resolve issues with technical systems and applications. Work is tracked using ‘tickets’.
You’ll also regularly communicate with other technical teams including vendors, developers and infrastructure on release management and issue resolution.

We're looking to expand our 20+ person credit research team by adding a Senior Credit Analyst to cover European credits within the Consumer & Services industries. Please note this role will be based in our London office and will report to the Director of Global Credit Research based in our US headquarters.

Conduct detailed industry and company fundamental analysis within the European Consumer & Services industries
Identify investment opportunities and advise portfolio managers
Support ideas with rigorous analysis
Build industry and company financial models
Interact and work with quantitative fundamental research tools

5-8 years of credit analysis experience covering European Consumer & Services credits
Excellent quantitative, qualitative and investment management skills
Experience analyzing credits across the credit spectrum (IG, HY and loans)
Some buy-side experience is preferred
BA/BS degree required
MBA degree, CFA designation viewed positively, but not required

Lord Abbett is one of the fastest-growing global asset managers with approximately $200 billion in assets under management. We seek to hire a diverse group of talented individuals who are committed to driving our vision to be the most respected asset manager in the world. We are looking for candidates who value excellence, responsibility, transparency, and collaboration as much as we do. Our employees share a passion for excellence in serving our diverse range of clients – individuals, advisors, and institutions across the globe who rely on us to deliver innovative investment solutions that help them secure stronger financial futures.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

The Financial Institutions Data Specialist role will be part of the Global Content Operations (GCO) organization, and will interface with teams across GCO, as well as other areas of Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions.

The data specialist will be a key component in Fitch's objective to strengthen our banking, insurance and non-banking financial institutions information, and will be highly influential in helping to shape our future direction, to meet the needs of clients for high quality, complete, accurate and timely data.

The role will require the candidate to analyse and interpret financial information across sectors, providing guidance to analysts on policies and procedures, designed to standardise the information as it is collected within Fitch templates. The candidate will also be involved in projects around automation as Fitch looks at ways to make the collection if data more efficient. The role involves close collaboration with the data analysis team, for the purposes of quality assurance, policy adherence and policy development. The role reports in to the Head of Financial Institutions Content.

Responsibilities:
Participating in regular meetings with Fitch ratings analysts to align goals and objectives for data representation
Ensure highest levels of data quality for banks, insurers and non-banking financial institutions, checking data has been correctly processed by the analysts and providing feedback when required
Initiate improvements to data support processes and procedures, by creating policies, and maintaining best practice documents for use in training and overall data capture process
Provide advice on modifications to data entry templates needed to reflect evolving analytical or industry circumstances
Actively participating in external client meetings, providing presentations to promote the Fitch product
Providing support to the Head of Financial Institutions Content and Financial Institutions Data Team Leader
Prepare and provide regular reporting to stakeholders about bank financial data
Qualifications and Experience:
Experience of working with fundamental data, in a accountancy, actuarial or auditing environment, with an understanding of IFRS, GAAP & wider accounting fundamental processes
A CIMA, ACCA, ACA qualified or part qualified candidate would be preferred
Excellent administration and communication skills
Proven experience of interacting effectively with senior management
Experience of working with offshore or outsourcing teams is highly sought
Must have a highly organised and methodical approach to work
To be a self-starter who can pick up new processes quickly and accurately
Have the ability to work within a team environment
Have a can-do attitude to problems
Sound knowledge of a second language would be an advantage
#LI-TD1

#LI-Solutions

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.

For more information about this policy, please visit the Code of Ethics and Conduct page.
Competitors: Economist Intelligence Unit, Roubini Global Economics

Job Description:
Role Overview

Contribute to the delivery of the strategic objectives of Close through the provision of business analysis. The current programme of change is designed to deliver major business transformational changes and ongoing BAU enhancements & efficiencies over a multi-year timeframe. Utilise a range of business analysis tools and techniques in order to deliver high quality business analysis artefacts within the Change function and associated projects.

Key Responsibilities

General

The role will involve applying business knowledge to the project environment. The candidate will need to:

Provide conceptual solutions to often complicated business problems and make recommendations for preferred solutions.

Contribute to the development of the business analysis approach and deliverables, and improve the integration with other disciplines across the software delivery lifecycle.

Lead requirements gathering and elicitation using a range of analysis tools and techniques.

Have ownership of traceability of analysis through development, testing, training through to business readiness and acceptance.

Work with Senior Management and up to Executive level to facilitate the sign off / agreement of solutions and recommendations.

Strong team working skills, with an ability to travel around the national office network to complete projects onsite where required.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills including negotiation.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills – must be able to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing.

Regulatory Responsibilities (Compliance/T&C)

Ability to demonstrate and understand the regulatory framework relevant to the role, whilst practising effective risk management at all times.

About the opportunity


Department Description

Investment Management Technology provides systems development, implementation and support services for Fidelity International’s global Investment Management division. We support Fund Managers, Research Analysts, Traders and other supporting groups in all of Fidelity International’s locations, including London, Dublin, Hong Kong, Toronto and Tokyo.

The Trading team have strong rapport with the investment management teams notably the trading teams in Equity, Fixed Income, FX and Derivatives. Projects range in scale and scope and will expose BAs to Portfolio Managers, Compliance, Operational teams, Regulatory Teams and pretty much every aspect of Asset Management.

Purpose of the Role

The role is within the Trading Platform team delivering ongoing RTB/ CTB activities to support business development and the requirements of the platform’s end users. The CRD platform is central to FIL’s IM practices and the candidate should have a proven track record in stakeholder management and project delivery for Front Office clients but also encompassing, middle office and technical teams. The candidate ideal candidate would have experience with Order Management and Trading functions within Charles River (other OMS applications will be considered). Stakeholder management is a key aspect of the role as BA’s operate with a great deal of autonomy being responsible for project delivery.

Key Responsibilities

Project Execution
Provide input into project timelines, estimation, action plans and risk management procedures
Ensure timely completion of work packages in line with project deadline and schedule
Act as a proxy customer facilitating open communication between the customer and development teams
Requirements Planning and Management
Work with Project Managers and Business Sponsors to agree on the Terms of Reference
Ensure that all Stakeholders have a common understanding of what is being delivered
Be self-sufficient in identifying and understanding business requirement/issues
Identify & escalate as appropriate, issues & instances where an agreed target or deadline is at risk or will not be met i.e. works to deadlines and manages client expectations
Requirements Analysis and Documentation
Form part of the conversation with the IM business on their target operating model
Identify requirements effectively and efficiently
Produce different forms of analysis documentation to an appropriate and agreed level of depth including Workflow / Swimlane diagrams, use case diagrams, component diagrams, story narrative documents, business requirement documents,
Deliver presentations and workshop sessions on requirements and solutions to stakeholder groups, clients and colleagues
Regularly review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes, estimates and recommendations relating to the proposed solution, to ensure they are up to date throughout the life cycle of the project
Generation of brief and clear documents that are fit for purpose i.e. appropriate to business issue, focused and suitable/tailored to the target audience.
The construction and maintenance of user guides and training material
Ensuring continuity by follow existing approaches and terminology where appropriate
Problem Solving
This is a key aspect of a Trading Business Analyst and the following aspects are highly valued Simple solutions, User centric, Standardisation and reuse of existing solutions and solving the problem without gold plating
Embedding (e.g. Testing, Training, Support, Process Re-engineering etc.)
Support the Test function with knowledge that aids test scripting & execution, including handovers & walkthroughs
Work with the Test team to define defects, acceptable tolerances within various types of testing
Test Automation progress activities on automated testing and contribute to / generate Feature files
Agile
FIL utilises Agile development practices and the candidate will need to contribute to: Stand Ups, Sprint Planning, Backlog Management and Retrospectives.
Collegiality
Contribute positively to the team in a collaborative fashion adopting and improving existing patterns and process
Other aspects would include Elicits and contributes to peer review, works independently, projects an assured presence, fails well, thinks outside the box, accepts and adapts to feedback
Experience and Qualifications Required

Skills
Excellent requirements analysis and consultative skills, with a logical approach to problem solving delivering simple and appropriate solutions
Ability to operate effectively with limited oversight
Excellent communication (written & oral), interpersonal and relationship management skills
Ability to work in a demanding and fast paced environment with speed and discipline
Confident working with senior management across multiple business areas
Ability to review proposed solutions and make recommendations
Comfortable with both SQL and Excel for analysis and problem resolution
Knowledge of PowerBI and Python would be a bonus
Industry Domain
Legislation - MiFID II, Compliance, RFR, DTO, CSDR
Financial Instruments: Equity, Bond, Future, CFD, Swaps, Options, Swaptions
Asset Management - Exposure, Duration, Risk Management, Attribution and Trading
Trade life cycle - Order gen, execution, settlement, rebooks, positions, corporate actions
Product Domain
FIX - Purpose, Configuration, Custom tags
CRD Configuration - Layouts, Blotters, Queries, Work Flow Rules, Sec Types, Investment Classes, Pricing, Analytics, Compliance Rule generation and testing, Permissions, Data Dictionary
CRD Product - NMWB, OMS and Compliance
CRD Release 17R1 or greater
EMS/MTF - TSOX, Tradeweb, Triton, EMSX, MarketAxess, and LiquidNet
Agile
Jira, Confluence, SharePoint, SDLC
About you
About Fidelity International


Fidelity International offers world class investment solutions and retirement expertise. As a privately owned, independent company, investment is our only business. We are driven by the needs of our clients, not by shareholders. Our vision is to deliver innovative client solutions for a better future.

Our people are passionate, engaged, smart and curious, and we give them the independence and the confidence to make a difference. While we take pride in the excellence of our investment solutions and client service, we know we can always do better. We are honest, respectful and make tough calls, challenging the status quo to achieve better outcomes through innovation. Above all else, we always put our clients first.

Job title: Business Analyst, Sales Technology
Job type: Permanent
Emp type: Full-time
Salary:
Negotiable
Location: London, United Kingdom
Job published: 2020-03-05
Job ID: 41713

Job Description

Our client is looking for a Business Analyst to join their London office. You will be expected to own the business process workflow within the technology platform for a key distribution channel within the firm. The platform includes the CRM system, Business Intelligence solution, and other integrated applications used by the business.

Responsibilities:
The focus of this position is to work closely with the business to understand their workflow and data needs from end to end and design the technical solutions to meet those needs.
On mid-size to larger projects you would be responsible for creating project plans, assigning tasks, tracking execution, as well as owning tasks.
On projects of all sizes you would be responsible for gathering requirements, designing solutions, testing solutions, communicating with stakeholders and executing training.
You would also be responsible for basic data transfer ensuring data from source systems reach the data warehouse and therefore would be expected to have or want to build some experience with SQL.


Requirements:
Having an in-depth understanding of the business processes of an asset management distribution function
Closely coordinating with business stakeholders to gather, organize, and prioritize requirements
Creating project plans for mid-size and larger projects and own the execution of the plan
Designing, testing, and training solutions provided to the business
Coordinating with development teams across the entire technology platform
Communicating with executive stakeholders on project status and deliverables
Writing and executing basic SQL queries to ensure data is appropriately reaching the data warehouse
Providing production support Requirements
Strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
Strong project management skills
Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects at once
Experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business
Extremely proficient in Excel and Powerpoint
Experience with task management tools such as JIRA
Experience in consulting a strong plus
Experience in the distribution arm of asset management a plus
Experience with SQL or the desire to learn
Experience in CRM and BI platforms
Education:
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
If you would like to be considered for the position of Business Analyst or wish to discuss the role further then please leave your details below. Your resume will be held in confidence until you connect with a member of our team

Acumen Solutions drives excellence - not only in our performance, but also in the results we deliver for our clients. We are a global cloud consultancy combining the insight of our strategists, the vision of our innovators, and the ingenuity of our engineers to achieve extraordinary impact. The Fortune 500 trust us to build solutions focused on growing revenue and profits by amplifying competitive advantage and strengthening customer relationships. Our groundbreaking solutions in the public sector streamline operations and improve productivity. We apply this same focus on excellence to our unparalleled social responsibility program, generating sustainable impact across our local communities. Engage with us at www.acumensolutions.com or on Twitter @AcumenSolutions.

Acumen Solutions is currently hiring Salesforce Business Analysts to join the team in our London, UK location.

Roles and Responsibilities

As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to Fortune 500 Companies and Government Agencies. Our Salesforce Business Analysts wear many hats on their projects and are responsible for everything from requirements gathering, Salesforce configuration, testing, training and post deployment support. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects and Technical Architects to design, develop, and deploy large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.

Key roles and responsibilities include:
Work with clients and end users to gather, understand, and define business requirements

Develop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions for our clients

Work collaboratively with team members to design a solution that will meet a client’s business requirements and fulfill user stories

Complete the configuration for user stories within Salesforce, AppExchange products, or other cloud-based technologies

Collaborate with developers to test and verify that solutions will meet the business requirements

Participate in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user training

Requirements

Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Products to develop client or business solutions

Hands on experience configuring Salesforce or similar CRM Product, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls

Proven ability leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast paced environment

Detail-oriented individual with the ability to quickly ramp up on new clients, their business needs, and technologies

Strong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skills

Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environment

Demonstrates flexibility and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done

Drive and desire to learn and grow both technical and functional skill sets

Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio
Salesforce Admin Certification and one Consulting Cloud Certification (Sales, Service or Community)
Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent

Ability to travel up to 50%

Preferred Experience and Skills

Experience leveraging and configuring AppExchange products to develop a solution

Experience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirements

Experience documenting user stories and creating to-be process flow diagrams

Experience collaborating with business stakeholders

Experience on a Salesforce implementation through the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder
Benefits

Acumen Solutions offers the opportunity for growth and advancement, as well as a competitive base salary, annual performance based incentives, medical and pension schemes, income protection, holiday/sick leave, and more.

Why is our Scheme Fees Manager the next step for you?
Scheme fees are determined by the card schemes (Visa / MasterCard etc) however these can be complex in nature with many factors impacting the applicable fee. These factors can be the country of card issuance, country of the retailer, transaction method etc. Additionally these fees and associated rules are frequently updated. This has a consequential impact to our processes and in this role you will be a key part in controlling these changes and processes by working cross-functionally and using your analytical skills.

How will you add value on a day to day basis?
Within this role you will become a subject matter expert on all Scheme related charges including interchange and network fees. You will be involved in updating the relevant teams such as sales, marketing, pricing and finance on developments, creation and provision of Fee related analytics. Capturing and analysing data through running queries in SQL you will look to identify and drive continuous improvement initiatives contributing towards achievement of business objectives. Collaborating on a cross functional basis to understand the impact of changes, you will ensure all documentation is updated for decision making purposes, investigating, where necessary, anomalies and incomplete information. You will also partner with technology so updates are captured and be responsible for the smooth running of month end activities. Finally you’ll assist in overseeing the financial control processes. This is a great chance to lead on analysis to find the root cause of variances; and identify and implement mitigating actions.

What will make you the ideal candidate?
The team is looking for driven new colleague with a positive approach to teamwork. You come from an analytical role and have experience with writing code in SQL and creating models in Excel. This role is all about initiating process improvements, so you enjoy problem solving and can present the solutions effectively to internal stakeholders as well as clients with great communication skills. Ideally you will have built up scheme fee knowledge in the payment industry – if not, we would really like you to be curious to expand your knowledge and be keen to understand the payment ecosystem.

How is Worldpay changing the world?
Worldpay has merged with Vantiv Inc. to create a new global leader in payments. The new Worldpay will have the scale, the reach and the resources to take our success story to another level. This move allows us to expand further into high growth markets, deliver innovation at scale and above all, brings together exceptional talent and a shared passion that will help propel us forward to the next chapter of our collective story.
Our technology enables billions of payments to be made each year whether online or in person. Working with customers large and small we help them to take payments quickly, safely and reliably, allowing them to grow their businesses and making your life more convenient in the process.

We are a leading digital bank on a mission to disrupt the banking industry. We've built an app with smart money management tools to help our customers live a healthier financial life. We also offer groundbreaking B2B banking and payments services.

Since our launch in 2014, we've surpassed 1 million accounts in total: including over 100,000 business accounts for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Our total deposits, meanwhile, have surpassed £1 billion over the same period.

We're a fully licensed UK bank, and we have the culture and spirit of a fast-moving, disruptive technology company. We've won the Best British Bank award two years running, and now employ more than 800 people across our London & Southampton offices, with more to come from Cardiff.

Everyone at Starling gets the chance to own interesting things from day one, and we’re told one of the best things about working here is the ability to achieve a lot in a short space of time.
To support our growth, we are looking for a Cyber Security Analyst to join our growing cyber security function.

Responsibilities

As a member of the Starling cyber security team, you will be working with some of the industry’s brightest cyber security professionals to protect Starling customer and company information assets and systems using the latest technologies and techniques.

The responsibilities for this role include:
Identification, quantifying and tracking of cyber security risks across the organisation.
Triage and management of information security events including, where necessary, participation in security incident management.
Gathering and analysing cyber threat intelligence to identify relevant emerging risks.
Security administration and auditing of privileged systems access.
Development and maintenance of security processes and procedures.
Participation in the evaluation and piloting of security products and services.
Participation in the creation, maintenance and implementation of security policies and standards.
Requirements

Essential:
A genuine desire to become a part of a technically strong security team.
Self motivation and willingness to learn.
Good basic technical IT knowledge.
A pragmatic and hands-on approach to problem solving.
Basic networking and associated protocol knowledge.
Preferable:

A high level understanding of mobile, network and operating system security controls.
Basic knowledge of public cloud (IaaS) technologies including relevant security and IAM controls.
Experience of performing information/cyber security reviews and/or audits.
Any experience of programming in Python, Go an/or Java.
A Cyber/Information Security related degree and/or relevant cyber security qualification(s).
Benefits
33 days holiday (including public hols). You’ll also get your birthday on us.
16 hours paid volunteering time a year.
Private Medical Insurance with VitalityHealth.
Contributory pension scheme.
Hot breakfast delivered on a Friday.
Our kitchens are stocked with fresh fruit and a range of hot and soft drinks.
We have many varied social groups set up and run by our employees.
Discounts on cinema tickets, restaurants, shopping and train tickets via a Perkbox membership.
Access to ‘salary sacrifice’ benefits such as Cycle to Work scheme.
Gym membership options.
Full details are available on our careers site.

Legislation - MiFID II, Compliance, RFR, DTO, CSDR
Financial Instruments: Equity, Bond, Future, CFD, Swaps, Options, Swaptions
Asset Management - Exposure, Duration, Risk Management, Attribution and Trading
Trade life cycle - Order gen, execution, settlement, rebooks, positions, corporate actions
Product Domain
FIX - Purpose, Configuration, Custom tags
CRD Configuration - Layouts, Blotters, Queries, Work Flow Rules, Sec Types, Investment Classes, Pricing, Analytics, Compliance Rule generation and testing, Permissions, Data Dictionary
CRD Product - NMWB, OMS and Compliance
CRD Release 17R1 or greater
EMS/MTF - TSOX, Tradeweb, Triton, EMSX, MarketAxess, and LiquidNet
Agile
Jira, Confluence, SharePoint, SDLC
About you
About Fidelity International


Fidelity International offers world class investment solutions and retirement expertise. As a privately owned, independent company, investment is our only business. We are driven by the needs of our clients, not by shareholders. Our vision is to deliver innovative client solutions for a better future.

Our people are passionate, engaged, smart and curious, and we give them the independence and the confidence to make a difference. While we take pride in the excellence of our investment solutions and client service, we know we can always do better. We are honest, respectful and make tough calls, challenging the status quo to achieve better outcomes through innovation. Above all else, we always put our clients first.

Job title: Business Analyst, Sales Technology
Job type: Permanent
Emp type: Full-time
Salary:
Negotiable
Location: London, United Kingdom
Job published: 2020-03-05
Job ID: 41713

Job Description

Our client is looking for a Business Analyst to join their London office. You will be expected to own the business process workflow within the technology platform for a key distribution channel within the firm. The platform includes the CRM system, Business Intelligence solution, and other integrated applications used by the business.

Responsibilities:
The focus of this position is to work closely with the business to understand their workflow and data needs from end to end and design the technical solutions to meet those needs.
On mid-size to larger projects you would be responsible for creating project plans, assigning tasks, tracking execution, as well as owning tasks.
On projects of all sizes you would be responsible for gathering requirements, designing solutions, testing solutions, communicating with stakeholders and executing training.
You would also be responsible for basic data transfer ensuring data from source systems reach the data warehouse and therefore would be expected to have or want to build some experience with SQL.


Requirements:
Having an in-depth understanding of the business processes of an asset management distribution function
Closely coordinating with business stakeholders to gather, organize, and prioritize requirements
Creating project plans for mid-size and larger projects and own the execution of the plan
Designing, testing, and training solutions provided to the business
Coordinating with development teams across the entire technology platform
Communicating with executive stakeholders on project status and deliverables
Writing and executing basic SQL queries to ensure data is appropriately reaching the data warehouse
Providing production support Requirements
Strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
Strong project management skills
Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects at once
Experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business
Extremely proficient in Excel and Powerpoint
Experience with task management tools such as JIRA
Experience in consulting a strong plus
Experience in the distribution arm of asset management a plus
Experience with SQL or the desire to learn
Experience in CRM and BI platforms
Education:
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
If you would like to be considered for the position of Business Analyst or wish to discuss the role further then please leave your details below. Your resume will be held in confidence until you connect with a member of our team

Why is our Senior Credit Analyst role right for you?
Worldpay has an expanding footprint both in the UK and on a global level. Adding new valued customers on a daily basis, the Credit Team plays a key role evaluating the initial and ongoing credit worthiness of our customers. Helping safeguard our credit exposure and revenue lines whilst protecting and advising our customers in a supportive manner sit at the heart of how our credit team operates.

What will I be doing on a day to day basis?
You will undertake quality credit risk assessments, within agreed service levels, as necessary for potential new Worldpay customers (including applications for increased/additional facilities)

You will also ensure quality credit risk assessments are undertaken on a timely basis on all facilities identified as requiring review as a result of monitoring processes and/or requiring annual review and undertake financial analysis demonstrating both insight and understanding across financial statements and relevant non-financial information

What will make me right for this role?
We are looking for a bright and ambitious individual who wants to further their career and take on additional responsibility. You will have 3+ years’ experience already within Credit Risk in a B2B environment, and will be comfortable being responsible for your own work load while prioritising day to day tasks when needed.

An excellent communicator, you will be comfortable in presenting credit proposals to senior internal stakeholders, and in conducting negotiations with customers at all levels. You will enjoy a challenge and will work well under pressure to strict timelines.

Job Description

Commodities Analysts work closely with Portfolio Managers to generate commodity investment ideas based on fundamental research and data analysis. Successful analysts are given greater responsibility and input into investment decisions, with the ultimate goal of growing into a Portfolio Manager role.

Key Responsibilities
Generate investment ideas based on fundamental research and data analysis
Build detailed fundamental commodity supply and demand models
Develop and expand analytics tools and processes while staying on top of market research and insights
Model commodity data for specific markets and produce ad hoc analysis based on short-term market developments
Evaluate and improve data quality

Skillset Requirements
Prior commodities experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in statistics, mathematics, computer science, finance or economics
High GPA (>3.8) / 1st Class Hons degree
Strong understanding of financial modeling, specifically using Python and/or VBA, Matlab
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, with strong attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and thrive in a fast-paced team environment
Opportunities available in London, Chicago and Greenwich

About Citadel


Citadel is a global investment firm built around world-class talent, sound risk management, and innovative leading-edge technology. For a quarter of a century, Citadel’s hedge funds have delivered meaningful and measurable results to top-tier investors around the world, including sovereign wealth funds, public institutions, corporate pensions, endowments and foundations.

With an unparalleled ability to identify and execute on great ideas, Citadel’s team of more than 675 investment professionals, operating from offices including Chicago, New York, San Francisco, London, Hong Kong and Shanghai, deploy capital across all major asset classes, in all major financial markets.
Competitors: Soros Fund Management, D. E. Shaw & Co. - Investment Firm, Fortress Investment Group

Job Description:
A Career in Long/Short Equities at Point72
Long/short equity is Point72’s core strategy and its success is dependent upon our sector-based investing teams. Using fundamental research, our Research Analysts inform the investment strategies of our Portfolio Managers. Through our Point72 University, you have access to an unparalleled training and coaching curriculum – so you can create your best chance of success. We offer you a clear path based on your abilities, hard work, and performance. Join us for a career at the forefront of investing.
What you’ll do
You’ll apply your financial acumen and curiosity to help shape your team’s investment strategies. Using comprehensive research you’ve conducted on companies, industries, and sectors, you’ll build financial models and investment theses. You will never stop learning, whether you’re honing your idea generation skills or applying insights from alternative data analysis. More specifically, you will:
Inform your team’s investment strategies through sophisticated financial models
Perform primary research; attend industry events; build relationships with sell-side analysts and research associates; and analyze big data
Develop your skills through coaching from your Portfolio Manager and by using the full breadth of the Professional Development resources available to you
Conduct yourself with the highest levels of professionalism and integrity in accordance with a best in class compliance program
What’s required
You’re never satisfied with the obvious answer and are always asking the next question. We want you to bring that restless intellect – and your hunger to get it right – to our investing process. While each Analyst role is unique to the specific team, all require the following:
1+ years’ experience in Investment Banking, Private Equity, or Public Investing
Undergraduate degree
Intellectual maturity, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
A gritty work ethic and a ceaseless desire to learn
Strong financial modeling, communication, and technical skills
We take care of our people
We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. We want you to concentrate on success and leave the rest to us. When you work here, we provide:
Fully-paid health care benefits
Life and Income Protection
Group Self Invested Personal Pension Scheme
Generous parental and family leave policies
Business Travel Accident Insurance
Corporate Wellness Programs
About Point72
Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here.
