As strategies, technologies and innovation collide, we create opportunity from complexity.

Our diverse teams of experts combine innovative thinking and breakthrough use of technologies to progress further, faster. Our clients adapt and transform, and together we achieve enduring results.

An innovation and transformation consultancy, we are over 3,200 specialists in consumer, defence and security, energy and utilities, financial services, government, health and life sciences, manufacturing, and transport. Our people are strategists, innovators, designers, consultants, digital experts, scientists, engineers and technologists. We operate globally from offices across the UK, US, Europe, and the Nordics.

Job Title: Data Analyst for the Skills for Prosperity (S4P) Hub
Job Description:
Data Analyst for the Skills for Prosperity (S4P) Hub

Apply Now

Become part of the team


Do you enjoy working with data? Do you have an interest in developing a career in economic development? Are you passionate about the role of education and skills in bringing prosperity to middle-income countries? Are you looking for an opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic organisation? If so, PA Consulting Group has a fantastic opportunity for a data analyst for the Skills for Prosperity (S4P) Hub as part of HMG’s Skills for Prosperity (S4P) programme.

Skills for Prosperity (S4P) Programme:

The S4P Hub provides a management facility for the DFID/FCO Prosperity Fund to support in-country Skills for Prosperity programmes in Brazil, Egypt, Kenya, Indonesia, Malaysia, Mexico, Nigeria, Philippines and South Africa. It will provide project management, procurement, M&E and technical assistance support to programmes and will gather evidence and communicate impact.

Skills for Prosperity (S4P) will:
Contribute to achievement of UK and international commitments on Agenda 2030 and the
Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). This includes SDG 4, to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all, as well as contributing to specific SDG 4 targets to: Ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university
Substantially increase the number of youth and adults who have relevant skills, including technical and vocational skills, for employment, decent jobs and entrepreneurship
Eliminate gender disparities in education and ensure equal access to all levels of education and vocational training for the vulnerable, including persons with disabilities, indigenous peoples and children in vulnerable situations
What we're looking for


As our S4P Analyst, and a key member of our S4P Hub team you will be responsible for:

Essential:
Experience in collating and analysing data and information to support the coordination and management of projects
Experience in project management or understanding of project management approaches
Experience in using varied and appropriate communications approaches to develop and maintain effective relationships
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and fluent in English for both speaking and writing.
Highly organised with the ability to manage complex work schedules to time.
Desirable:
Good understanding of English Language Training (ELT), Higher Education (HE) and Technical & Vocational Education & Training (TVET) systems, particularly UK systems and approaches
Fluency in any languages spoken in S4P programme countries is an advantage but not essential
This role is suitable for industrial placements students, recent graduates or those with alternative qualifications but with the appropriate skills and experience.

Candidates must be willing and eligible to undergo pre-employment screening and relevant security clearances. This role is UK-based (London) with potential infrequent overseas travel.

Please apply with your full CV. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted very promptly.

We can also offer this job as a 1 year Fixed Term Contract or a 3 year Fixed Term Contract (up until March 2023).

Benefits


• Pension
• 25 days holiday

Exciting opportunity to join Beazley's Executive Risks division as an Analyst, providing analytical and research support across the full range of US-focused D&O and EPL products. This is a broad and varied role covering economic and industry trends, new product research, claims analysis, reviewing portfolio mix and performance, marketing materials and managing changes to pricing. The successful candidate will have excellent knowledge of the corporate world with experience in analysing its strengths and weaknesses, ideally within the US market, and will need good statistical analysis skills and the ability to understand complex models and concepts. Strong time organisation, task prioritisation and stakeholder management is a must.

Beazley is a friendly, flexible and innovative employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds.

Job description and person specification

Job Title: Analyst – Executive Risks

Division: Cyber & Executive Risks (CyEx)

Key Relationships: Underwriters, claims staff, actuaries, brokers, external clients and suppliers

Job Summary: To provide analytical and research support and project management to the Executive Risk teams.

Key Responsibilities
Research and analyse sector trends to report regularly back to the wider team on issues that may affect/inform underwriting including macro events, industry shifts, litigation trends and loss experience.
Manage internal database of competitors.
Maintain database of securities class actions and report regularly on trends and findings.
Assist in the maintenance of marketing materials based on sector research, litigation trends, competitor offerings.
Respond to data management requests across Executive Risks in a timely fashion, including quarterly claims analysis for M&A and reinsurance teams.
Continued development of the D&O and EPL pricing models to identify trends within the US corporate market that may affect the relevant books of business.
Test assumptions within the D&O and EPL rating models to ensure accuracy and that they reflect current thinking.
Work as part of the “core model team” on the D&O book to drive the development of the rating model and manage regular the update of the model to reflect new information and/or thinking in order to develop ‘best in class’ pricing models.
Understand the US corporate environment, company structures and working practices and the potential exposure for the D&O account.
Monitor historic claims trends across industry segmentations in the US corporate environment in order to analyse and identify drivers within each segment and predict likely future claims scenarios in each.
Study industry or company data to update information in current Executive Risks pricing models or develop new models in conjunction with the actuarial pricing team.
Scope out proposals by the team for launching new products or extending the reach of existing products.
Work with the claims team to analyse our own experience on claims in terms of defence costs, indemnity, monitoring costs, types of allegations etc.
Work with external data providers in testing of data provision in conjunction with the pricing team.
Undertake ad hoc data requests and analyses, including liaising with internal stakeholders such as the Data Management and Underwriting Management teams.
General

At Beazley we are committed to doing the right thing because it is the right thing to do. It is important that within all your interactions both internally and externally you adhere to this principle through adoption of Beazley’s core values and behaviours – PIED and Being Beazley.
Adopt the Beazley culture of Professionalism, Integrity, Effectiveness and Dynamic that contributes to an internal environment of teamwork and promote a positive brand image and experience to our external customers.
Comply with Beazley procedures, policies and regulations including the code of conduct which incorporates the PRA and FCA Conduct Rules. Undertake training on Beazley policies and procedures as delivered by your line manager, the Talent Management development or assurance teams (compliance, risk, internal audit) either directly, via e-learning or the learning management system.
Display business ethics that uphold the interests of all our customers.
Ensure all interactions with customers are focused on delivering a fair outcome, including having the right products for their needs.
Comply with any specific responsibilities necessary for your role as outlined by your line manager, the Talent Management or assurance teams (compliance, risk, internal audit) and ensure you keep up to date with developments in these areas. This may include, amongst others, Beazley’s underwriting control standards, Beazley’s claims control standards, other Beazley standards and customer relationship management.
Carry out additional responsibilities as individually notified, either through your objectives or through the learning management system. These may include membership of any Beazley committees or working groups.
Personal Specification:

Education and Qualifications
Graduate – ideally with a degree in mathematics, statistics or economics
Skills and Abilities
The ability to manage time, meet deadlines and prioritise
Proven statistical analysis skills
Ability to understand complex models
Accurate and numerate
Computer skills – good working knowledge of MS Office, advanced Excel skills.
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail
Strong communication skills
Motivational skills: team worker as well as able to work on own initiative
Knowledge and Experience
General commercial and financial knowledge
General insurance statistical experience, ideally within the London or US markets
Excellent knowledge of the corporate world with experience in analysing its strengths and weaknesses, ideally within the US market
Aptitude and Disposition
Outcome focused, self-motivated, flexible and enthusiastic
Professional approach to successfully interact with managers/colleagues/external suppliers
Independent thinker; lateral and creative
Competencies
Achievement orientation
Analytical thinking
Conceptual thinking
Information seeking
Customer focus
Team working
Initiative
Using expertise
Integrity, impact and influence

Job Title: Office of the CAO | Reference Data, Project Manager/Business Analyst
Job Description:
Job Description

The Team:


We are looking for leaders and problem solvers who are passionate about data and data management.

The purpose of the Project Management/Business Analyst (PM/BA) role within the Reference Data Operations team is to independently evaluate business requirements and recommend solutions in support of a reference data universe that spans Citadel’s global footprint. The role requires effective management of both short term, tactical solutions as well as longer term, multi-quarter strategic initiatives.

A successful candidate will be a proficient PM/BA who communicates and collaborates effectively, taking ownership and accountability for all aspects of each project assigned to them. They will manage requests throughout their life-cycle from business analysis, to prioritization, to collaboration with technical counterparts, through to delivery and business acceptance. The ability to work across a wide range of stakeholders; business and technical, internal and external is central to the role.

Responsibilities:

Reporting to the PM/BA Lead, the PM/BA will evaluate current tactical issues, lead small/mid-size initiatives, and contribute to enterprise-wide strategic initiatives.
Work with front and back office stakeholders across the organization to design and deliver comprehensive reference data solutions across a wide range of asset classes, geographies, and instrument types.
Assist in management front/middle office requests to development teams to ensure concepts are properly evaluated, implemented, and risk assessed.
Evaluate systems for opportunities to automate with focus on highest return on investment.
Help design and implement metrics for tracking product and operational health.
Manage tracks within larger strategic initiatives.
Work with stakeholders within the organization to refine and improve knowledge and processes.
Design and implement processes that facilitate the use and administration of reference data.
Required Skills
5 or more years of professional experience in financial services, particularly reference data or technology
Extensive product knowledge across a broad array of financial products and Instruments
Experience supporting data integration, data governance, data life cycle management, data quality, and data strategy
Strong analytical, quantitative skills
Project Management and Business Analysis experience
Experience in developing metrics (Tableau preferred)
Python, SQL, or similar for data analysis and tool building (preferred)
Education: BA/BS Bachelor’s Degree (STEM degree preferred)

Strategists occupy the intersection of finance, markets, maths, computer science, and programming. Working side by side with the firm’s trading, sales, banking and investment management professionals, members of the business unit use their mathematical and scientific training to create financial products, advise clients on transactions, measure risk and identify market opportunities.

Our quantitative analysts focus on the pricing and
risk management of complex transactions, ranging from pension fund buyout
trades to exotic assets and derivatives. We are looking for some who can work
on a large project, develop cutting edge analytics, and implement production
quality pricing, analysis and risk management systems.

In their daily work, Strats work closely with our traders and structuring teams, analysing trades and asset origination opportunities for execution and ongoing measurement and management. This emphasis on advanced financial mathematics and a highly analytical approach as an integral part of the risk management of the firm distinguishes Rothesay Life from many of its competitors. In general, we are looking for smart, quantitative, commercial, problem-solving-oriented, “get-things-done” candidates with the skills to deliver robust, high performance software and quantitative analyses and with either experience in financial markets or a keen interest to learn about them.

Job Description:
We are always looking for exceptional talent to join us as our business grows. If you like the sound of what we do and the role description sounds like you, reach out to us to discuss future opportunities.

Analyst

London

Fahrenheit 212 is a global innovation, strategy and design firm. We define innovation strategies and develop products, services, and experiences that create sustainable, profitable growth for our clients.

We are looking for an Analyst to join our London office. We’re looking for someone with the ability to think strategically and creatively, and with passion for developing and expressing new ideas and opportunities. You should be self-propelled by relentless curiosity, resourceful in scouring the world for insight and comfortable in a fast-paced environment.

Your Responsibilities

As an Analyst, you would be working with cross-functional project teams and collaborating closely with members of our Idea Development, Strategy and Design teams. You would be responsible for:
Performing in-depth industry research, extracting key takeaways and organizing them into actionable and digestible documents
Supporting category assessment, competitive analysis and financial modeling
Contributing to the development of innovation strategies and idea portfolios
Identifying needs and desires of consumers, behavior trends, and potential opportunities
Stimulating and inspiring cross-functional teams – both internally and externally
Building key deliverables to be presented to senior executives in our client organizations
Your Future

You would be entering a two-year Analyst Program designed to help you develop a broad range of relevant skills, and prepare you for a potential transition to a role as an Associate in either our Strategy or Idea Development teams. In addition to regular team training sessions, you would be assigned a mentor to work with you on building specific skills and capabilities aligned to pre-defined professional development goals.

Our Requirements

You should have a bachelor’s degree, demonstrating strong academic success and leadership, ideally with internship experience and experience in financial analysis. You should excel in working in collaborative, group based environments. You should be a lateral thinker, adept at uncovering the themes and critical pieces of information that can spark game-changing innovations. You should be self- propelled by restless curiosity, resourceful in scouring the world for insight, comfortable in a highly charged idea-centric environment, fascinated with changing the world, able to move seamlessly from high altitude thinking to the tangible and practical.

You should be able to demonstrate the following characteristics:
Creative Problem-Solving. You should have an intuitive ability for identifying gaps in markets and developing new markets in those gaps.
Comfort with financial tools and analysis. You should be able to work comfortably in Excel and be able to explore, reflect on and contribute to financially driven insights as well as reflect on the business implications of consumer insights.
Creative Sensibilities. You should have an aesthetic appreciation, and ideally experience working with creative teams across a range of disciplines and deliverables.
Contagious Passion. You should see and be inspired by disruptive innovation and transformational ideas, and be able to stoke the fires of those around you.
Considered Opinions. You should be able to form thoughtful and considered perspectives, supported by both objective fact and strategic conviction.
How to Apply
Tell us “Why Fahrenheit 212?” in 200 words, in your cover letter.
Attach your resume or CV.
Submit application.

A Career in Long/Short Equities at Point72
Long/short equity is Point72’s core strategy and its success is dependent upon our sector-based investing teams. Using fundamental research, our Research Analysts inform the investment strategies of our Portfolio Managers. Through our Point72 University, you have access to an unparalleled training and coaching curriculum – so you can create your best chance of success. We offer you a clear path based on your abilities, hard work, and performance. Join us for a career at the forefront of investing.
What you’ll do
You’ll apply your financial acumen and curiosity to help shape your team’s investment strategies. Using comprehensive research you’ve conducted on companies, industries, and sectors, you’ll build financial models and investment theses. You will never stop learning, whether you’re honing your idea generation skills or applying insights from alternative data analysis. More specifically, you will:
Inform your team’s investment strategies through sophisticated financial models
Perform primary research; attend industry events; build relationships with sell-side analysts and research associates; and analyze big data
Develop your skills through coaching from your Portfolio Manager and by using the full breadth of the Professional Development resources available to you
Conduct yourself with the highest levels of professionalism and integrity in accordance with a best in class compliance program
What’s required
You’re never satisfied with the obvious answer and are always asking the next question. We want you to bring that restless intellect – and your hunger to get it right – to our investing process. While each Analyst role is unique to the specific team, all require the following:
1+ years’ experience in Investment Banking, Private Equity, or Public Investing
Undergraduate degree
Intellectual maturity, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
A gritty work ethic and a ceaseless desire to learn
Strong financial modeling, communication, and technical skills
We take care of our people
We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. We want you to concentrate on success and leave the rest to us. When you work here, we provide:
Fully-paid health care benefits
Life and Income Protection
Group Self Invested Personal Pension Scheme
Generous parental and family leave policies
Business Travel Accident Insurance
Corporate Wellness Programs
About Point72
Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here.

We're looking for an experienced, professional and enthusiastic business analyst to join a our team.

The purpose of the role:

The aim of the role is to understand, document and communicate business requirements in use case form, particularly in relation to user tools, so that the development team can deliver and maintain the resulting systems and technical solutions.

Success will be achieved by capturing, analysing and documenting requirements and then supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with stakeholders, seeking buy-in and agreement on technology changes.

The role requires a good knowledge of working in an agile development team delivering large-scale multi-tenanted web applications and APIs using use cases, TDD & BDD.

Responsibilities
Identify, analyse and document business processes & workflows. Identify opportunities for streamlining and improvements.
Comfortable communicating technical issues to stakeholders in a way that makes the business impact clear. Able to communicate project issues so there is an understanding of the problem and options for how it would be solved.
Facilitate decision making with the stakeholders, including engineers, web developers, project managers, UX designer and test engineer. This will include conversations about scope, about the detail of individual requirements and bigger picture approaches to the solution, and about providing clear options.
Work with the test engineer to support, facilitate, or execute acceptance tests, ensuring the delivered solution meets the business requirements and agreed quality criteria
With the Project Manager and technical leads, lead and facilitate the task breakdown and assessment of user stories.
Where appropriate gather, analyse, and report usage data or other such relevant data in support of measuring the performance of the product
Requirements

Skills and Requirements:
Substantial Business Analysis experience with a focus on requirements gathering and documentation, and story breakdown into tasks.

Started in 2000, Efficio is a specialist management consultancy, focused on procurement and supply chain improvement programmes. There are currently c.450 employees globally, with exciting plans to grow rapidly in the next 18 months. We are a truly international organisation with over 30 different languages spoken. The firm places a high value on its employees and offers great training and development opportunities, to help with career progression. Our consultants return to their home office each Friday from their client engagement to spend time with their colleagues and attend training courses.
Description Given the growth that Efficio is going through, we are looking for Business Analysts (BAs) in various locations to provide support to project teams working on consulting assignments. Business Analysts roles are targeted at graduate entry level candidates and are the first step into management consulting. Although based out of our office in Piccadilly Circus, London, our BAs might, from time to time, be required to be on client site up to 4 days a week, depending on project needs. Because of this, flexibility to travel is essential.

Working under the guidance of an experienced consultant, their key role is to collect, analyse and synthesise large data sets from a variety of sources, mastering the use of Excel and SQL. The insights and understandings from their analysis provide important inputs to the project team's recommendations and solutions.

BAs also provide input to client presentations, and work alongside the digital team to support the day-to-day delivery of projects - for example, they may assist with developing and issuing RFPs and evaluating proposals from suppliers via eFlow, as well as utilising Tableau to visualise the results of various analyses and support the project team in presenting the data in the most effective way. They interact with clients and their suppliers as needed.

BAs are typically involved in client facing projects at client sites from day one, so they need to be able to learn fast and get up to speed quickly and work effectively under pressure. BAs must be able to work independently, while also being team players who are willing to contribute wherever needed to ensure the success of the project. The ability to prioritise their work effectively in the face of sometimes competing demands is also essential.

BAs are expected to challenge existing ways of doing things and suggest new ideas. However, they are also expected to be able to justify their conclusions and recommendations with relevant experience and rigorous, fact-based analysis.

Efficio has a collaborative, supportive culture where performance is recognised and success is celebrated. BAs are supported to continually develop their skills and expertise through a comprehensive training and development programme including formal training (through the Efficio Academy), on-the-job training, and coaching and mentoring from experienced consultants and Efficio executives. The opportunities and support that come from a role as an Efficio BA make it an unmatched springboard into a top-tier consulting career.
Essential Requirements • An exemplary academic background; preferably with a top degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or Economics

• Another European language (in addition to English) or Arabic, is highly desirable

• Must have the right to work in the country in which you are applying
Desirable Requirements • Strong analytical skills and problem solving ability

• Ability to isolate key issues and draw sound conclusions

• Proficiency in the use of Excel and PowerPoint

• Proactive, enquiring approach

• Strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders

Business Analyst

We are currently seeking a Business Analyst to lead the business analysis efforts on a range of public services that are at the forefront of what technology. You will be expected to:
Work independently
Have an excellent understanding of business analysis
Sensitively elicit the needs and requirements of the organisation
Propose solutions
Contribute to the business analysis community with Agilisys
Manage stakeholder relationships
Be flexible on working location
Skills needed for this role

Agile working. You are experienced in working in cross functional or matrix teams consisting of a mix of people from the client and supplier. You can identify and compare the best processes or delivery methods to use, including measuring and evaluating outcomes. You know how to help the team to decide the best approach. You can help teams to manage and visualise outcomes, prioritise work and work to agreed scope. You have a working knowledge of the GDS Service Manual and can evangelise the benefits of Agile working.

Business analysis. You can take responsibility for investigative work into problems and opportunities in existing and new services. You know how to drive the analysis and collection of information to create recommendations for service improvements. You can analyse large amounts of complex information and use it to produce solutions. You can clearly describe a solution so that it is understandable by all members of a cross functional team.

Business improvement process. You know how to analyse current services and processes (these will often include offline processes as well as legacy technology systems) and can identify and implement opportunities to optimise these. You can lead others to create innovative solutions.

Business modelling. You can model more advanced and complex situations across more than one business function or programme. You know how to gather insight from senior stakeholders and communicate modelling results clearly to them.

Business Benefits. You can derive and model potential benefits from a solution and use this to create business cases.

Digital perspective. You can apply a deep understanding of digital solutions to your work. You can identify the limitations and solutions for those with limited skills or abilities with digital technologies.

Enterprise and business architecture. You can contribute to the creation and maintenance of the target operating model and identify the impact on operational service.

Methods and tools. You can select and support the right tools and methodologies within the common Agilisys business analysis framework and you can identify areas that require a more tailored approach. You can estimate and provide planning support on business analysis tasks. You can contribute to the business analysis community within Agilisys to improve processes.

Analysis techniques. You can develop and facilitate structured workshops with complex and resistant stakeholder dynamics. You can facilitate the setting of business priorities for change initiatives of high complexity and where there are competing needs.

Stakeholder relationship management. You have working experience of undertaking projects within the public sector, ideally local government. You can influence stakeholders and manage relationships effectively. You know how to build long-term strategic relationships and communicate clearly and regularly with stakeholders.

User focus. You know how to collaborate with user researchers and can represent users internally. You understand the difference between user needs and the desires of the user. You can champion user research to focus on all users. You can prioritise and define approaches to understand the user story, guiding others in doing so. You can offer recommendations on the best tools and methods to be used.

About Agilisys

Stemming from one of UK's leading digital venture builder, Agilisys is home to people that love solving complex problems and making change happen by having a passion for technology and digital disruption. As an Employee Owned business, our people are our main asset, and everyone has a real say in the direction that the business is heading.

In Customer Experience Management (CXM) practice, we work with our clients to design and deliver solutions that can involve creation of services and operating models, building business cases and the subsequent change programmes; undertaking whole system/service evaluations or delivering complex multi-partner implementations – no job is the same.

We bring an insightful, questioning and highly informed perspective and our people are driven by the quest to keep delivering next-generation business and digital solutions to solve our public and private sector clients' challenges.

Our Ethos

Insulet started in 2000 with an idea and a mission to enable our customers to enjoy simplicity, freedom and healthier lives through the use of our Omnipod® product platform. Position Overview:

We are looking for a committed and enthusiastic team member to join our FP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) department in our London office. Our organization supports the rapid growth of our international business activities, outside of the US (OUS). 2020 is a transformational year, as we are launching our new product Omnipod DASH™, and expanding activities geographically.

Part of Finance organization, OUS FP&A team manages the budgeting, forecasting and analytical processes for Europe, Middle East (EMEA) and Canada. We are a currently a team of three. Our mission is to support our stakeholders set, achieve and measure performance against operational and financial ambitions, bringing them a robust financial expertise combined with an active business partnering mindset.

As the FP&A Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring Financial controlling for Operating Expenses (OpEx) and Headcount, including analysis, forecasting and budgeting, for our EMEA business.

Leading OpEx and Headcount budgeting and quarterly forecasting
Assisting with monthly closing process, including adjustments requests to accounting, accruals consolidation and review, Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) analyses and commentaries

Building analyses to answer ad-hoc requests

Job Title: Future Opportunities - Business Analyst, Financial Crime Technology Advisory, Sanctions Screening
Job Description:
Your opportunity
There has never been a better time to embark on a career using advanced technologies to combat economic crime. Join us in defining and building transaction monitoring solutions that make a material difference to our clients, our people and society.
As part of the Financial Crime team in Forensic, you will provide high quality advice to prestigious organizations, helping clients to use cutting edge technology to identify and stop economic crime. Whether it be analyzing and designing new defenses, selecting and implementing new technologies or optimizing existing tools, you will be a part of the evolution in a global effort to fight financial crime.
We are seeing strong demand for Financial Crime specialists from our clients as a result of the significant regulatory pressure and increasing complexity of financial crime risks. To handle this demand Deloitte has over 1200 staff globally who are specifically working in financial crime. Offering a range of specialisms and experience, Deloitte was ranked in the ‘Leaders’ Quadrant by Gartner and a focus on innovation and investment in technology has helped Deloitte maintain market leadership in the industry. This is the opportunity to join a diverse team of dedicated professionals that provide high quality and innovative advice that helps our client manage the risks that financial services firms face on a day-to-day basis.
Your role
In your role, you will help our clients to assess financial crime risks and to select and establish the financial crime solutions that fit their requirements. You will have the opportunity to interact with multi-disciplinary Deloitte teams and cutting edge technology suppliers, established and start-ups, helping to solve our clients’ most significant challenges. You will also work closely with the leadership of our Financial Crime practice, contributing to shaping our growing Financial Crime Technology Advisory business.

Due to the varied nature of our projects, you will have the opportunity to develop your expertise in number of areas and expand a wide set of additional skills. Leading a small project team you will help to find solutions for clients on projects typically driven by compliance and risk problems, mainly in the financial crime and regulatory fields. You will work directly with our clients to understand the challenges they face and design, propose and deliver solutions that address them.
You might work with business audiences to define a strategy and a technology roadmap, including selecting technology options and shaping delivery timelines.

Your responsibilities will vary depending on the focus of your client engagement and your skillset, but could include and/or require the following:
Scoping the delivery of Financial Crime technology projects, working closely with clients and other project stakeholders to understand their requirements;
Communicating complicated technology concepts to business audiences with ease;
Working with the client stakeholders and SMEs to identify technology and/or data strategy goals and objectives, considering their Financial Crime risks and their business challenges;
Capturing technology requirements and analyzing them into technology solutions;
Defining appropriate target state solutions and helping the clients select the appropriate technology and data components;
Defining the delivery roadmap and the more specific project plans for Financial Crime technology projects, working closely with clients and other project stakeholders to manage successful delivery;
Building a broad network of client relationships within the financial crime community and wider financial services industry;
Participating in business development initiatives and the preparation of go-to-market offerings
Managing diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognized for their contribution
Contributing to the overall business management and leadership of the Financial Crime team;
Contributing to the firm’s talent agenda, managing and working effectively in diverse teams and helping to foster an inclusive culture where people are recognised for their contribution;
Supporting the ambition of the team to be the leading Financial Crime Technology advisors experts in the UK and beyond, through growing the team to enable development of a broad range of quality client relationships across all industries and through the adoption of both cutting-edge and well-established technologies;
Your work, your choice
How long does impact take? How long is a piece of string? How many seconds does a solution contain? How can we possibly tell? After all, impact can be huge or small. Immediate or years in the making. At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk.
We, therefore, carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. If the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated below, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements.

Location: London with occasional domestic and international travel

Suggested work pattern: Permanent full-time. Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we will try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
We want people who will embody a collaborative approach in bringing both business and technology stakeholders together to deliver technology solutions that enable tangible business benefits. At Deloitte, our people are expected to have the professional and personal skills to provide a distinctive client experience during our engagements. We understand that we need different types of people with different skills to provide our clients with the best possible service. So whether you are a delivery specialist, business advisor or technical master you will be able to find something exciting and entertaining.

To qualify, you must possess demonstrable knowledge, a proven ability to deliver with significant experience in financial crime and technical or data architecture design.

Essential:
Experience of a market leading or startup technologies in Sanctions Screening domain (e.g. EastNets, Oracle, BAE Systems, SAS, FICO, LexisNexis etc.);
Sanctions Screening and Financial Crime domain expertise and/or technical knowledge acquired from a Compliance, Business or IT perspective;
Experience in analyzing technology requirements and defining/selecting appropriate solutions;
Ability to work with and lead project teams, helping to motivate team members;
Supporting the development of colleagues through mentoring and knowledge sharing;
Excellent verbal and written communication skills that you can adapt to technical and non-technical audiences;
Contribution to or development of proposals and propositions for internal or external clients.
Experience of working on projects for external clients;
Experience of working in or working on projects in regulated industries, particularly financial services.
Your wider skills must include:
A range of both technical and business focused skills and experience, and an ability to articulate the outcomes and value of their work and career achievements to date
Competent use of the Microsoft suite, including Excel and PowerPoint to manage data sets, create reports
Strong skills in written and oral communication (including presentation skills)
A passion for understanding and empathising with our client problems and helping to resolve them through innovative approaches and dedicated support
Substantial experience and knowledge across a broad spectrum of financial crime and financial services industry themes
Deep interest in innovation and a drive to build personal eminence in the industry
Continual pursuit of broadening the skills of themselves and the team
Your service line: Financial Advisory
Advising clients in the moments that define their business takes multiple layers of expertise. Much more than due-diligence, this is about diverse teams of specialists coming together, crossing service lines and international borders to tackle the many, complex issues involved in major transactions. And we have one of the broadest networks in the business. Here, you will find fascinating, career-building projects, market leading approaches, cutting-edge resources, huge clients and inspirational colleagues. As well as opportunities to develop a deep industry or product specialism.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Malta, the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,500 partners and over 40,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.

Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.
WPFULL SLFINA BAFRSC

Job Title: Future Opportunities - Business Analyst, Financial Crime Technology Advisory, Transaction Monitoring
Job Description:
Your opportunity
There has never been a better time to embark on a career using advanced technologies to combat economic crime. Join us in defining and building transaction monitoring solutions that make a material difference to our clients, our people and society.
As part of the Financial Crime team in Forensic, you will provide high quality advice to prestigious organizations, helping clients to use cutting edge technology to identify and stop money laundering and economic crime. Whether it be analyzing and designing new defenses, selecting and implementing new technologies or optimizing existing tools, you will be a part of the evolution in a global effort to fight financial crime.

We are seeing strong demand for Financial Crime specialists from our clients as a result of the significant regulatory pressure and increasing complexity of financial crime risks. To handle this demand Deloitte has over 1200 staff globally who are specifically working in financial crime. Offering a range of specialisms and experience, Deloitte was ranked in the ‘Leaders’ Quadrant by Gartner and a focus on innovation and investment in technology has helped Deloitte maintain market leadership in the industry. This is the opportunity to join a diverse team of dedicated professionals that provide high quality and innovative advice that helps our client manage the risks that financial services firms face on a day-to-day basis.
Your role
In your role, you will help our clients to assess financial crime risks and to select and establish the financial crime solutions that fit their requirements. You will have the opportunity to interact with multi-disciplinary Deloitte teams and cutting edge technology suppliers, established and start-ups, helping to solve our clients’ most significant challenges. You will also work closely with the leadership of our Financial Crime practice, contributing to shaping our growing Financial Crime Technology Advisory business.

Due to the varied nature of our projects, you will have the opportunity to develop your expertise in number of areas and expand a wide set of additional skills. Leading a small project team you will help to find solutions for clients on projects typically driven by compliance and risk problems, mainly in the financial crime and regulatory fields. You will work directly with our clients to understand the challenges they face and design, propose and deliver solutions that address them.
You might work with business audiences to define a strategy and a technology roadmap, including selecting technology options and shaping delivery timelines.

Your responsibilities will vary depending on the focus of your client engagement and your skillset, but could include and/or require the following:
Scoping the delivery of Financial Crime technology projects, working closely with clients and other project stakeholders to understand their requirements;
Communicating complicated technology concepts to business audiences with ease;
Working with the client stakeholders and SMEs to identify technology and/or data strategy goals and objectives, considering their Financial Crime risks and their business challenges;
Capturing technology requirements and analyzing them into technology solutions;
Defining appropriate target state solutions and helping the clients select the appropriate technology and data components;
Defining the delivery roadmap and the more specific project plans for Financial Crime technology projects, working closely with clients and other project stakeholders to manage successful delivery;
Building a broad network of client relationships within the financial crime community and wider financial services industry;
Participating in business development initiatives and the preparation of go-to-market offerings
Managing diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognized for their contribution
Contributing to the overall business management and leadership of the Financial Crime team;
Contributing to the firm’s talent agenda, managing and working effectively in diverse teams and helping to foster an inclusive culture where people are recognised for their contribution;
Supporting the ambition of the team to be the leading Financial Crime Technology advisors experts in the UK and beyond, through growing the team to enable development of a broad range of quality client relationships across all industries and through the adoption of both cutting-edge and well-established technologies;

Your work, your choice
How long does impact take? How long is a piece of string? How many seconds does a solution contain? How can we possibly tell? After all, impact can be huge or small. Immediate or years in the making. At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk.
We, therefore, carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. If the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated below, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements.

Location: London with occasional domestic and international travel

Suggested work pattern: Permanent full-time. Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we will try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
We want people who will embody a collaborative approach in bringing both business and technology stakeholders together to deliver technology solutions that enable tangible business benefits. At Deloitte, our people are expected to have the professional and personal skills to provide a distinctive client experience during our engagements. We understand that we need different types of people with different skills to provide our clients with the best possible service. So whether you are a delivery specialist, business advisor or technical master you will be able to find something exciting and entertaining.

To qualify, you must possess demonstrable knowledge, a proven ability to deliver with significant experience in financial crime and technical or data architecture design.

Essential:
Experience of a market leading or startup technologies in Transaction Monitoring (TM) domain (e.g. Actimize, Mantas, BAE Systems, SAS, etc.);
Transaction Monitoring and Financial Crime domain expertise and/or technical knowledge acquired from a Compliance, Business or IT perspective;
Experience in analyzing technology requirements and defining/selecting appropriate solutions;
Ability to work with and lead project teams, helping to motivate team members;
Supporting the development of colleagues through mentoring and knowledge sharing;
Excellent verbal and written communication skills that you can adapt to technical and non-technical audiences;
Contribution to or development of proposals and propositions for internal or external clients.
Experience of working on projects for external clients;
Experience of working in or working on projects in regulated industries, particularly financial services.

Your wider skills must include:
A range of both technical and business focused skills and experience, and an ability to articulate the outcomes and value of their work and career achievements to date
Competent use of the Microsoft suite, including Excel and PowerPoint to manage data sets, create reports
Strong skills in written and oral communication (including presentation skills)
A passion for understanding and empathising with our client problems and helping to resolve them through innovative approaches and dedicated support
Substantial experience and knowledge across a broad spectrum of financial crime and financial services industry themes
Deep interest in innovation and a drive to build personal eminence in the industry
Continual pursuit of broadening the skills of themselves and the team

Your service line: Financial Advisory
Advising clients in the moments that define their business takes multiple layers of expertise. Much more than due-diligence, this is about diverse teams of specialists coming together, crossing service lines and international borders to tackle the many, complex issues involved in major transactions. And we have one of the broadest networks in the business. Here, you will find fascinating, career-building projects, market leading approaches, cutting-edge resources, huge clients and inspirational colleagues. As well as opportunities to develop a deep industry or product specialism.
Personal independence

Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

Requisition code: 177248

WHAT WILL I BE DOING?:
As a Finance Business Analyst, you will report into & work with the the AllSaints Technology & Business Analysis teams, being responsible for analysing the As-Is processes for all aspects of Finance. You will have a good understanding of AP, AR and General Ledger processes, including inventory valuation, standardised monthly reporting and statutory financial reporting. Working with the Accounting, AR, AP and Tax teams to document AS-IS and develop To-Be processes. You will be working closely with the project management, business analysis, architecture and QA teams in several AllSaints Programmes, and you will have excellent Retail knowledge and be able to communicate effectively with and influence end users at all levels.

THE ROLE

Analyse, document and propose solutions for technically complex business areas
Prepare functional specifications
Analyse and document business processes
Document workflows and results of business analysis and obtain sign-off from stakeholders
Be the link between stakeholders, development team and any third party IT supplier, throughout the development lifecycle
Facilitate workshops with stakeholders
Gather Business Requirements for IT projects
Working with the Technical Architect to help develop system designs
Create Business Requirements documentation – high level and low level and explain/communicate those to all business and IT interested parties
Create Functional Specification documents
Assess the impact of changing requirements
Identify options for potential solutions and assess for both technical and business suitability.
Produce Test Scenarios and work with the Quality Assurance analyst.
Facilitate training sessions with end users on the new system.

WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED FOR THE ROLE?:
Demonstrable evidence of analysing and documenting complex business processes and use cases
End to end experience of the project lifecycle
Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills
Writing requirements and functional specifications
Experience with Usability, Wireframes, User Journeys, Use Cases
Ideally would have experience in writing User Manuals and providing training to users
Develop an understanding of the business issues and data challenges of the IT platforms and AllSaints' organisation
Assist in the preparation of user and system test plans based on business requirements; design and execute the test scenarios and test scripts
Able to deal with stakeholders at all levels and ideally have experience in assessing the cost of various technical solutions and where relevant suggesting suitable alternative solutions

A BIT ABOUT ALLSAINTS AND THE TEAM:
Here at AllSaints we pride ourselves on our customer centric global team and our vision to continually make the coolest clothes to evoke emotion for our customers, worldwide.

AllSaints is proud to be identified as one team; everything about our style and creativity is curated in-house, from store design and construction to our brand image & clothing design. We are truly an agile business which works at pace and takes responsibility in the work we produce.

We are a brand embarking on a very exciting plan and we are seeking new members of the team who want to contribute to this.

WHAT WE STAND FOR

Customer Centric: We work as one proud team to get the best for our customers

One Team: We are joined up and encourage others to share their ideas

Work at Pace: We know our goals, and we work with clear outcomes in mind

Take Responsibility: We are self aware, understand the impact we have on others and are positive about the future

WHY IS ALLSAINTS FOR ME?

Your career matters to us and we will do what it takes to help you on your journey in life. You’ll be challenging yourself and your leadership. The opportunities will be there and you’ll be working within an environment that rewards hard work and innovation. Internal promotion is the norm not the exception and you’ll be supported in your ambition to reach the next step of your career.

You’ll be working in our East London Studios based in London’ vibrant Shoreditch with perks and benefits offered from local businesses including discounts on food, shopping and health & beauty. In addition to this we offer competitive pay and benefits package that includes an amazing employee uniform allowance and discount.

We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we very much look forward to working with you.

Insulet started in 2000 with an idea and a mission to enable our customers to enjoy simplicity, freedom and healthier lives through the use of our Omnipod® product platform. In the last two decades we have improved the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients by using innovative technology that is wearable, waterproof, and lifestyle accommodating.
We are looking for highly motivated, performance driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!

Position Overview:

We are looking for a committed and enthusiastic team member to join our FP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) department in our London office. Our organization supports the rapid growth of our international business activities, outside of the US (OUS). 2020 is a transformational year, as we are launching our new product Omnipod DASH™, and expanding activities geographically.

Part of Finance organization, OUS FP&A team manages the budgeting, forecasting and analytical processes for Europe, Middle East (EMEA) and Canada. We are a currently a team of three. Our mission is to support our stakeholders set, achieve and measure performance against operational and financial ambitions, bringing them a robust financial expertise combined with an active business partnering mindset.

As the FP&A Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring Financial controlling for Operating Expenses (OpEx) and Headcount, including analysis, forecasting and budgeting, for our EMEA business.

Responsibilities:

Reporting to OUS FP&A Sr. Manager, you will play an important role in supporting the company size and allocate investments, as well as performing and improving our reporting and monitoring. You will work closely with functional and country heads to help them manage their budget. You will be a connecting link between the US corporate Finance and the business teams.

You will be part of our development by maintaining and continuously adapting our reports and processes to business needs, as well as to organizational and systems evolutions.

Your main responsibilities will consist in, while not being limited to:
Leading OpEx and Headcount budgeting and quarterly forecasting
Assisting with monthly closing process, including adjustments requests to accounting, accruals consolidation and review, Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) analyses and commentaries
Tracking actuals spend, providing monthly updates and variance analyses
Monthly updates and Budget management support to Budget owners
Providing content for monthly Financial, Business and Budget reviews
Leading continuous improvement to reporting and forecasting processes
Supporting systems implementation and improvements
Building analyses to answer ad-hoc requests
Experience/Competencies
Bachelor or Master’s degree in Finance/Accounting or another relevant field
Minimum 1-2 years of working experience, preferably FP&A in Public company
Strong knowledge of Excel and ability to work with different IT systems
Fluent in English (additional European language is a plus)
Strong analytical skills
Team-oriented and solid interpersonal skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines
Open-minded, curious, and solution-seeking
Knowledge of Financial planning tools (e.g. Planful/Host Analytics, Hyperion, Cognos TM1) is an asset
Previous experience in the Healthcare industry is a plus, but not required

Job Description


Liquidnet Europe Limited is looking for a Fixed Income Support Analyst to work within their EMEA Product Support Team. The team requires a motivated self-starter who has the technical skills to support a growing number of buy-side members in London and across Europe utilising their FIX, Linux, Windows Server, database and networking skills.

This role will be predominantly based on the Fixed Income desk working directly with salespeople and interacting with users and technical teams across the Liquidnet membership. This is an exciting opportunity to join a strategically important Fixed Income business within Liquidnet which is moving into new areas of the asset class. This will be a varied role involving working on a multitude of cross-platform market-leading technologies to support the running of our bespoke trading platform. The successful candidate will be responsible for front-to-back support duties on the Fixed Income platform which will include the daily support of the platform, configuring new members, managing front-end upgrade rollouts and testing of new functionality prior to release to members.

The successful candidate should possess a positive ‘can-do’ attitude and an intuitively high level of customer service in their approach. This will complement strong FIX, database (SQL, Sybase or Oracle), as well as Linux, Windows and Networking troubleshooting skills.

Responsibilities
Utilising proprietary tools, provide daily application support and troubleshooting for platform members and internal users, escalating to Development teams appropriately
Member configuration and administration of MTF functionality
Troubleshooting and analysis of order routing and trade flow and post-trade issues
Perform regional start of day health checks to ensure all processes are up and members are connected to the platform
Working within a shift rota to provide London support coverage from 7am – 6pm
Contribute towards ‘follow the sun’ support model, working closely with global teams to ensure
pre-market health checks are performed for each region
Daily interaction with Sales and Trading with regards to support issues
Create and track issues within an incident-tracking system to help identify trends and patterns
Create and monitor internal reports and usage queries
Assist with product testing and project work
Occasional weekend work will be required during major upgrades and out of hours testing
Qualifications / Skills

Essential:
3 years hands-on support experience within a financial institution (venue/platform provider, buy-side, sell-side)
Hands-on working knowledge of at least one industry-recognised Order Management System
Solid application support experience within a Unix / Linux environment
Knowledge of the FIX protocol and experience supporting FIX flows
Hands-on experience of MSSQL, Oracle and Sybase database environments, including query-writing
Demonstrable working knowledge of Fixed Income products and flows
Proven experience of supporting Windows Server environments
Experience in troubleshooting network problems: i.e. firewall and routing problems
Desirable:
Exposure to Liquidnet workflows from an E/OMS perspective
Exposure to supporting message-based architecture (Solace, TIBCO etc)
ITIL Foundation qualification and experience working within an ITIL framework
An understanding of Debt Capital Market structures and processes
Experience in programming or scripting languages
Person Profile
Must have excellent customer focus skills
Ability to confidently communicate well at all stakeholder levels (technical contacts, members, traders, executive team etc.)
Excellent organisational skills
Responds positively to a high-pressured support environment
Willing to embrace core business values demonstrated in day-to-day work ethic
Analytical and disciplined approach to problem-solving
Must be a team player with ability and interest in participating in new projects and assisting other departments within the company
Motivated self-starter who takes ownership of their responsibilities, with the ability to work autonomously
Must be flexible in relation to working hours
Positive approach
Should be somebody who relishes the prospect of supporting an expanding business and contributes to the transformation of support functions

IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

The Business Analyst is primarily responsible for meeting with system end users to evaluate system enhancement needs. They will be responsible for gathering requirements and communicating needs to development team. The BA will support all aspects of IT projects including developments, installation, design and implantation following the SDLC process.

Summary of Essential Job Functions

 Identify and author requirement documentation by partnering with key stakeholders to ensure business needs are met
 Communicates system changes, status and issues to all stakeholders
 Acts as a liaison between the stakeholders and development team
 Author of Traceability Matrix
 Manage Test Plan and Test Script/Scenarios creation to ensure end results meet specified business requirements and follow the SDLC process
 Assist in recording and documenting system issues that require fixes
 Assist with the testing efforts of new system enhancements
 Review executed testing and any associated defects
 Ensures system knowledge sharing by training key personal and providing support
 Participation in system implementation and migration activities
 Provide support and guidance to Payment Department when questions arise as it relates to systems
 Support QA activities as needed
 Manage enhancements to the current operating system through the development life cycle
 Managing change requests related to working project plans daily to meet the agreed deadlines
 Other duties as assigned

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

IQVIA, Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.

Apply Now!
Competitors: PPD, INC Research, PRA Health Sciences

Job Description:
Why is this your next step?
Worldpay is the global leader in the payments industry. Our client base includes some of the largest online retail merchants operating in the global economy. We are looking for a Pricing Analyst to join the e-commerce pricing team whose remit it is to develop the pricing strategy, pricing models/governance and commercial pricing initiatives.

How you will contribute?
Operating as a commercial business partner, you will conduct pricing analysis providing recommendations on market conditions to support and contribute to the e-commerce strategy.
You will conduct profitability, price sensitivity, risk and scenario analysis and work on opportunities for price optimisation. You will carry out pricing projects and initiatives to generate incremental revenue for the business.
You will support the sales force in assisting with their queries on pricing policy and the pricing model

Why you?
You will have had exposure to a business environment – preferably financial setting (FP&A, pricing, etc.) but aren’t going to set the bar high for experience level
Strong numerical skills are essential so a degree in maths, economics or a finance will be advantageous. Blending communication and influencing skills you should be comfortable engaging with a wide range of business areas whether via email or in face to face discussions/presentations.
You will be a self-starter; curious nature and eager to learn; energetic personality and a confident speak and communicator.
It is desirable that you have FP&A or Pricing experience

Join the Team.
We lift economies and communities by advancing the way the world pays, banks and invests.
Since our two companies came together, Worldpay has formed the Merchant Solutions division of FIS. We call it “Worldpay, from FIS”. In the time you’ve taken to read this one sentence, our platforms have processed over 8,000 transactions and this number grows daily. Join us now to realise your own future growth and success.
FIS stays ahead of how the world is evolving to power businesses, across merchants, banking and capital markets, to outpace today’s fast-changing competitive landscape and help our clients run, grow and achieve more for their business.
We want all our people to bring their very best self into work, and that means balancing priorities and passions, at work and at home. We create teams without barriers, fostering creativity and innovation - behaviours that we value in everything we do.

Amazon seeks a Senior Finance Analyst to play a key role on the Amazon Payment Products Finance team, primarily supporting the Amazon UK CoBranded Credit Card. The person in this role is responsible for long and short term financial planning, controllership of monthly financial reporting, reporting on weekly financial and operational performance metrics, and providing analytical support for Senior Business Management. This position will be a key risk/controllership gateway for the payments business and requires a candidate with strong communication and leadership skills. A portion of the time will be spent on ad hoc analysis to support the growing business needs. The finance team works closely with the business teams, so any candidate should be able to work well with cross functional teams. The ideal candidate must have superior attention to detail, project management skills and the ability to successfully manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously. Strong analytical skills are required.
Ideal candidates will have the following strengths:
- Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced environment.
- The ability to translate large amounts of data into useful information and actionable conclusions.
- Strong written and oral communication skills combined with the ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads.
- An understanding of finance issues in an operational environment of rapid growth.
- Solid business judgment and controllership focus.
- Strong PC modeling skills, including excellent knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, and SQL.

Basic Qualifications

· BA/BS degree required
· At least 5 years of professional Finance experience
· Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (macros, pivots, lookups)
· Proficiency in English
· Payments experience

Preferred Qualifications

- MBA/CPA preferred - Ability to thrive and grow quickly in a fast growing company - Strong leadership skills - Highly analytical and detail oriented - Proven ability to work independently in an ambiguous environment -relevant finance experience in a large, multinational organization, with world-class processes. - Financial Services experience preferred

Our research division FXC Intelligence is looking for a research analyst to expand our custom research efforts and produce content related to the payments, FX, and financial service industry.
Role description
This role will have two primary functions: first, conducting desk research into trends and companies within the financial services space to populate our online data portal; second, helping produce FXC Intelligence’s weekly newsletter and other custom research reports. This role has significant room for growth and expansion as all content and research work is currently being split between other employees.

FXC Intelligence is a growing startup in the FinTech space - we will provide plenty of training and support but once up to speed you will be encouraged to make this role your own!

Requirements
Ability to synthesize disparate data into concise written reports
Familiar with both qualitative and quantitative data
Demonstrated analytical ability
Ability to produce work within tight deadlines
Excellent English
Responsibilities
Producing written intelligence reports about trends within the payments and financial services industry
Helping write, source content for, and edit a weekly newsletter
Supporting our data science and product team with ad hoc desk research
Generating new ideas for content and marketing
Nice to have
Data journalism, financial / equity research, or other quantitative research experience
Experience with data manipulation using Python, Matlab, Stata, etc.
Experience working in payments, finance or FinTech
What we offer
Competitive salary & incentive schemes
Fantastic benefits package
Regular team outings and events
Relaxed dress code
Tailored personal development program
Use of a Mac laptop
If you are interested in this opportunity, please get in touch.
