Job Title: NERA Economic Analyst - Valuation, Intellectual Property and Transfer Pricing, Paris office
Job Description:
With its main office in New York City, NERA serves clients from more than 25 offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. NERA has been consistently ranked in the top 3 Economic Consulting firms by Vault (www.vault.com) in the last 10 years.

The role

Our Global Transfer Pricing, Valuation and Intellectual Property Practice offers a full range of independent advice, and valuation support by world-class economists who operate in major locations around the globe and who team effectively to provide global solutions for multinational clients. Our direct, hands-on approach enables us to develop more rigorous, higher quality products, and to collaborate more effectively with our clients. Clients range from some of the largest and best-known companies in the world to mid-size companies, and they cover numerous iconic brands.

We have an immediate opening for a full-time Economic Analyst in Paris, ideally starting in Spring 2020. Economic Analysts are responsible for developing detailed industry analyses, financial and economic models, and conducting quantitative, statistical and comparative valuation analyses. They are also expected to contribute to the preparation of economic and financial reports.

The Paris team works with a wide range of industries such as Energy; Transportation; Telecommunication; Fashion; Cosmetics; Luxury; Retail; Life Science etc.

The Paris team works on projects involving assets and company valuation; intercompany transaction pricing for products and services; intellectual property mapping and analysis; pricing of financial instruments; assistance to contract negotiation in relation to remuneration clauses, Tax audits assistance, quantification of damages arising from commercial and Intellectual Property-related disputes; as well as International Arbitration.

The successful candidate will work primarily within the Valuation Intellectual Property, and Transfer Pricing team in Paris as well as with other practices within NERA. They would join a dynamic and inspiring team of PhDs, graduates from the Grandes Ecoles and top tier universities, who work globally with NERA’s other European and US offices, on challenging technical topics. Given the size of the team, new joiners are proactively integrated within the team and join projects from the start.

You will need

Candidates must hold a master’s or PhD qualification from a top tier university, in Economics, Finance or a related discipline with exceptional analytical skills and strong academic records.
Ideal candidates will have a mixed economic and financial valuation background with three years’ experience working in corporate finance or valuations. Experience in Transfer Pricing would be an advantage.
Qualified candidates must be detail-oriented and have the ability to think analytically and critically, and have excellent technical, oral and written communication skills.
Business fluency in English and French is essential and other European languages would be an advantage.

What we offer

Competitive salary and flexible benefits package.
The opportunity to work with an international team of highly experienced professionals in a dynamic consulting environment.
Work on high profile cases and with clients across the globe
Firm-sponsored social activities
There may be an opportunity for international travel

Application process

To apply for this position, please submit your CV and a cover letter. For more information about NERA, please visit our website (www.nera.com).

Senior Marketing Business Analyst

International Business Analytics

About GW Pharmaceuticals

GW Pharmaceuticals is a cutting-edge UK-based biopharmaceutical company that over the last 20 years has established a world-leading position in cannabinoid science and the development of regulatory approved medicines derived from cannabis. Our mission is to transform the lives of seriously ill patients and their families. In October 2018 our achievements were recognized by TIME magazine which named GW as one of the ‘Top 50 Genius companies of 2018 that are inventing the future’.

Having developed the world’s first prescription medicine derived from the cannabis plant, Sativex®, which treats spasticity due to multiple sclerosis, GW has now developed an oral formulation of purified cannabidiol (CBD), (approved as Epidyolex® in Europe) for use as adjunctive therapy of seizures associated with Lennox Gastaut syndrome (LGS) or Dravet syndrome (DS), in conjunction with clobazam, for patients 2 years of age and older. Lennox-Gastaut syndrome or Dravet Syndrome are two rare and severe early-onset, drug-resistant epilepsy syndromes. CBD is approved in the US as Epidiolex. This is in addition to our deep pipeline of clinical stage cannabinoid candidates under development for both orphan and non-orphan indications with a particular focus on neurological conditions.

In the UK, we have close to 550 employees from a diverse range of backgrounds and disciplines based on four sites in Cambridge, Kent, London and Andover, along with employees working in the field. We also have a strong presence in the U.S. with around 250 U.S. employees, based both in Carlsbad, CA and in the field.

We are continuing to build out our teams and are looking for talented individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit, dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our patients, and to exemplifying our company values.

Please go to www.gwpharm.com for additional information.

Senior Marketing Business Analyst
1. Job Purpose


The individual will be a key member of the International marketing team and will be a key driver for all business analytics related to the growth of the brand and feeding into the overall strategy and brand plans for GW’s epilepsy portfolio across the International Markets countries (defined as all ex-US territories).

2. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES


· Develop and maintain a deep understanding and key strategic insights into the evolving EU epilepsy market, clinical data and Epidyolex

· Contribute to the development of the EU and Developing Markets Epidyolex launch plan with all analytical aspects required

· Initiate and analyse market data, including competitive intelligence and trends, to generate key insights to drive brand direction

· Drive all brand related market research with HCP, patients or caregivers in alignment with the brand team and brand needs

· Drive the brand adoption in using the right key metrics during the launch of Epidyolex e.g message recall

· Update and maintain the sales forecast in alignment with the line manager

· Measure the feasibility of the strategy and the effectiveness of the promotional tactics

· Work collaboratively with the US colleagues

· Contribute to a seamless Medical : Marketing : Market Access interface

· Establish and nurture customer relationships within the epilepsy community across markets where Epidyolex is to be commercialised

· The job holder is responsible for maintaining cGxP and H&S knowledge applicable to the job.

3. DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES


· Contribution to and maintenance of the International Epidyolex commercialisation plan, utilising stakeholder and market insights

· Maintain a deep understanding of the Epidyolex data to build the strategy, positioning and messaging, create the differentiation and value added for the product

· Measure the feasibility of the strategy and the effectiveness of the promotional tactics

· Conduct market research across indications for the brand Epidyolex

· Forecasting for International markets for Epidyolex and potential pipeline products

· Attending international congresses and stakeholder meetings if required

· Project support across team members

· 10-20% international travel

· Carries out their work in a way that will not adversely affect their own, or others’, health, safety and security or the environment and reports any shortcomings in GW arrangements

4. KEY ATTRIBUTES/SKILLS/EDUCATION - ESSENTIAL


Knowledge:

· PhD/Master’s degree in science or business

· Deep and demonstrable knowledge of business analytics in Marketing and/or in the Pharmaceutical sector

· Proven Product Launch Experience

Experience:

· Neurology or rare disease experience preferred

· Experience in managing multiple projects and vendors

· Proven team-working ability within diverse cross-functional teams

· Proven and demonstrated experience in strategic and tactical planning

Relevant pharmaceutical experience

Skills:

· Strong collaboration and team-working skills

· High degree of IT literacy in particular strong excel & power point skills

· Strong analytical skills and thinking, strategic acumen and excellent attention to details

· Cultural sensitivity

· Strong communication skills including written and presentational

· Fluent spoken/written English and ideally additional languages

Attributes and Behaviours:

· Displays and demonstrates the Corporate Values

· Develops and maintains positive working relationships with others

· Shares ideas and information

· Assists colleagues as and when required

· Demonstrates a ‘can do’ approach

· Willingness to undertake all tasks required to launch a product in a small organization

· High desire to maintain optimal compliance requirements in all activities

GW's VISION:

Unlock the potential of cannabinoid science to transform the lives of the patients and their families

GW's MISSION:

Lead the world in developing and commercialising regulatory approved cannabinoid medicines, putting patients first

Our efforts are guided by several fundamental values. At all times we strive to be:

Patient Driven – We never forget who we're striving for

Passionate – We are here to change lives

Innovative – We challenge ourselves to find new and better approaches

Collaborative – We accomplish more through working together and valuing one another

Accountable – We take responsibility and deliver on our commitments

Integrity – We are fair, honest, and ethical

Excellence – We pursue the highest standards for ourselves and for our industry

Join Us!

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GW Pharmaceuticals (“GW”) does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GW’s Talent Acquisition department to obtain prior written authorisation before referring any candidates to GW. The obtaining of prior written authorisation is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GW. In the absence of such written authorisation being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GW. GW shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

CBRE Global Workplace Solutions is a leading global provider of integrated facilities and corporate real estate management. We are recruiting a Senior International Finance Analyst to join the team located in London. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing aspects of both the client’s real estate costs across the International portfolio and CBRE’s related Profit and Loss.

Role Summary:

• Modelling, reporting and preparation for the reimbursement of c.$35m staff and platform costs including management fees
• Management of the annual International incentive compensation payments process of c.$2m. Provide financial and analytical support for the incentive compensation accounting and forecasting processes. Undertake ad-hoc related projects
• Support CBRE Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) business unit analysts by being the first point of contact for issues and questions
• Manage and report of c.270 headcount across the international scope
• Prepare and present monthly consolidated global reporting of financial and non-financial spend and metrics to the global finance team
• Maintain and develop various financial models and standard templates distributed for use by all of Finance during the planning processes, ensuring quality, accuracy and focused analytic review
• Undertake special projects to improve process efficiency and performance as assigned by Management; build analytical models that utilise both financial and non-financial data to forecast operating results
• Provide information to management by assembling and summarising data; preparing reports; making presentations of findings, analyses, and recommendations
• Develop complex financial models and present analytics to support the financial modelling related to potential expansion or contraction activity
• Perform strategic and scenario analysis to determine present and future financial performance; conduct comparable analysis as necessary in support of key business metrics and objectives
• Lead and manage the recommendation of service line measures on reducing non-relevant business expenditures and other cost saving strategies; seek approvals of such identified saves from the client governance team for contribution towards the annual cost saves target
• Devise IT solutions and test IT systems to explore inefficiencies
• Manage new technology solutions through design, development, implementation and end user rollout; prepare and distribute quick reference guides with new technology
• Regular review and update of JLL financial playbooks
• Drive overall process improvements ensuring global consistency

Experience Required:

• Professionally qualified accountant, ACA, ACCA or CIMA, minimum 5 years post qualified
• Good understanding in the core disciplines of accountancy, maths and economics
• Exposure to continuous planning – rolling forecasts environment
• MS Office product literate, advanced excel modelling and data manipulation skills
• Working knowledge of JD Edwards / PeopleSoft experience
• Exceptional IT skills including ability to explore data-orientated structures (data modelling) and familiarity with data-management programming language such as VBA
• Familiarity with banking systems, gathering, storing and organising data for use with Business Intelligence tools
• Ability to engage and present issues for resolution, both internally and to the Client
• Robust capacity to work under pressure
• Highly organized to ensure critical contract deadlines are met every month
• Experience of engaging and working with contacts in overseas locations to produce an internationally consistent end product

About CBRE Global Workplace Solutions:

As one of the business units in CBRE, Global Workplace Solutions provides end-to-end services across the complete lifecycle of the workplace, helping to improve business operations and reduce cost. As a one-stop solutions provider with a broad array of long-term customers and customized services, Global Workplace Solutions has delivered US$3 billion in savings to customers over the past ten years.

CBRE Group, Inc., a Fortune 500 and S&P 500 company headquartered in Los Angeles, is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm (in terms of 2014 revenue). The Company has more than 70,000 employees and serves real estate owners, investors and occupiers through more than 400 offices worldwide

Application Process:

Your application will be reviewed by our Talent Resourcing Team and you will be contacted if you have been successful in being short listed for the role.

No agencies please.

Please note: The job title shown above may be different to local job titles used in our business and issued on any contract of employment.

#CBREGWS

Job Title: London - Financial Consultancy Roles in Risk, Regulation and Compliance London
Job Description:
FDM Group is a FTSE 250 award-winning employer that recruits, trains and deploys talent globally. We are a leading IT graduate employer, working with some of the world’s most reputable organisations including Shell, HSBC and Virgin Media, to name a few. We are currently looking for bright, highly motivated and talented graduates with the drive to work in Risk, Regulation and Compliance.

As a Risk, Regulation and Compliance Analyst you will be an essential asset to the organisation, providing analytical and regulatory support and responding to the combination of technological advances and increased regulation that may affect a business. Duties include Due Diligence, Anti-Money Laundering and Regulatory Reporting, the monitoring of upcoming regulations, performing risk assessments and preparing reports and detailed analysis for senior stakeholders.

The training will take place at the FDM London academy, situated in the heart of the city centre. Once you have completed training, you will be working with our world-renowned clients in Europe. After the two years, you can remain with FDM or you may have the opportunity to transition to an in-house role at FDM or to carry on working with the client as a member of their permanent team.

What we offer you:
Industry recognised training and qualifications
Key skills development e.g. stakeholder management, communication, planning and Microsoft Excel
A minimum of two years’ commercial experience, with the potential to become full-time
Mentoring and on-going support throughout your career with FDM
Essential experience and skills required:
Professional working proficiency in French
Excellent communication skills and an ability to build relationships
Ambitious, with a drive to succeed within the technology industry
Degree of 2:2 or higher
Strong analytical ability
Good decision-making skills within fast-paced environments
Be geographically flexible throughout the UK and Europe to support our clients
Be able to commit to a two-year contract with FDM upon completion of the training period
Don’t miss this opportunity and apply today to secure a place on our programme.

The Quantitative Analyst is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities:
Develop analytics libraries used for pricing and risk-management
Create, implement, and support quantitative models for the trading business leveraging a wide variety of mathematical and computer science methods and tools including hardware acceleration, advanced calculus, C++ including STL, C#, .NET, Java, object oriented software design, Python, kdb, Structured Query Language (SQL), mathematical finance/ programming and statistics and probability
Develop pricing models using numerical techniques for valuation including Monte Carlo Methods and partial differential equation solvers
Collaborate closely with Traders, Structurers, and technology professionals.
Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure
Build a culture of responsible finance, good governance and supervision, expense discipline and ethics
Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same, demonstrating proper consideration for the firms reputation.

Investment Management Technology provides systems development, implementation and support services for Fidelity International’s global Investment Management division. We support Fund Managers, Research Analysts, Traders and other supporting groups in all of Fidelity International’s locations, including London, Dublin, Hong Kong, Toronto and Tokyo.

The Trading team have strong rapport with the investment management teams notably the trading teams in Equity, Fixed Income, FX and Derivatives. Job Title: Senior Accountant - Global Financial Accounting & Controls
Job Description:
We are seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Accounting organisation and become a major contributor to our Accounting team. As key member of the UK and Global Accounting team, this individual will be based in London. A successful candidate in this position will have demonstrable experience with financial reporting and internal control related responsibilities.

In addition to the accounting and reporting responsibilities, the individual will drive cross-border projects and develop best practice in processes and controllership on an international level. They will also drive implementation of policies with the financial leadership team based out of worldwide Amazon locations.

Candidates for this position will have held supervisory or management positions in companies with less than one billion in annual revenues, will have worked for a big four public accounting firm at the manager level with Fortune 500 clients or equivalent, or have worked in a large public company as a manager. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate they were top performers at their level.


Basic Qualifications

· BA/BS required
· ACCA, ACA, and CIMA or similar credentials
· Relevant accounting experience (public accounting /industry mix preferred)
· Exposure to operational accounting concepts of inventory, procurement, payables, receivables, and revenue
· Demonstrated ability participating in milestone driven projects
· A strong desire to exceed expectations
· Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
· Solid organizational, project management skills, and information technology aptitude

The ideal candidates will be experienced, talented finance or accounting professionals who are passionate and excited about accounting and reporting and have experience with the details of a monthly close cycle, periodic financial reporting and related analytical analysis.

Traits we are looking for in a candidate are a strong desire to exceed expectations, effective interpersonal skills; including persuasive written and oral communication, solid organizational skills, ability to assess and manage risk, and willingness to get into the details whilst also seeing and understanding the big picture.

Preferred Qualifications

· Worked in a fast paced company similar to a high-tech start-up
· Strong interpersonal written and oral communication skills
· Is naturally a very organizational individual
· Has an aptitude for information technology
· Excellent analytical skills
· Exposure to researching accounting conclusions, documenting support for conclusions reached

Job Description:
Why is our Senior Credit Analyst role right for you?
Worldpay has an expanding footprint both in the UK and on a global level. Adding new valued customers on a daily basis, the Credit Team plays a key role evaluating the initial and ongoing credit worthiness of our customers. Helping safeguard our credit exposure and revenue lines whilst protecting and advising our customers in a supportive manner sit at the heart of how our credit team operates.

What will I be doing on a day to day basis?
You will undertake quality credit risk assessments, within agreed service levels, as necessary for potential new Worldpay customers (including applications for increased/additional facilities)

You will also ensure quality credit risk assessments are undertaken on a timely basis on all facilities identified as requiring review as a result of monitoring processes and/or requiring annual review and undertake financial analysis demonstrating both insight and understanding across financial statements and relevant non-financial information

What will make me right for this role?
We are looking for a bright and ambitious individual who wants to further their career and take on additional responsibility. You will have 3+ years’ experience already within Credit Risk in a B2B environment, and will be comfortable being responsible for your own work load while prioritising day to day tasks when needed.

An excellent communicator, you will be comfortable in presenting credit proposals to senior internal stakeholders, and in conducting negotiations with customers at all levels. You will enjoy a challenge and will work well under pressure to strict timelines.

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

The Financial Institutions Data Specialist role will be part of the Global Content Operations (GCO) organization, and will interface with teams across GCO, as well as other areas of Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions.

The data specialist will be a key component in Fitch's objective to strengthen our banking, insurance and non-banking financial institutions information, and will be highly influential in helping to shape our future direction, to meet the needs of clients for high quality, complete, accurate and timely data.

The role will require the candidate to analyse and interpret financial information across sectors, providing guidance to analysts on policies and procedures, designed to standardise the information as it is collected within Fitch templates. The candidate will also be involved in projects around automation as Fitch looks at ways to make the collection if data more efficient. The role involves close collaboration with the data analysis team, for the purposes of quality assurance, policy adherence and policy development. The role reports in to the Head of Financial Institutions Content.

Responsibilities:
Participating in regular meetings with Fitch ratings analysts to align goals and objectives for data representation
Ensure highest levels of data quality for banks, insurers and non-banking financial institutions, checking data has been correctly processed by the analysts and providing feedback when required
Initiate improvements to data support processes and procedures, by creating policies, and maintaining best practice documents for use in training and overall data capture process
Provide advice on modifications to data entry templates needed to reflect evolving analytical or industry circumstances
Actively participating in external client meetings, providing presentations to promote the Fitch product
Providing support to the Head of Financial Institutions Content and Financial Institutions Data Team Leader

A CIMA, ACCA, ACA qualified or part qualified candidate would be preferred
Excellent administration and communication skills
Proven experience of interacting effectively with senior management

To be a self-starter who can pick up new processes quickly and accurately
Have the ability to work within a team environment
Have a can-do attitude to problems
Sound knowledge of a second language would be an advantage

Job Title: NERA Economic Analyst - Valuation, Intellectual Property and Transfer Pricing, Paris office
Job Description:
With its main office in New York City, NERA serves clients from more than 25 offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. NERA has been consistently ranked in the top 3 Economic Consulting firms by Vault (www.vault.com) in the last 10 years.

The role

Our Global Transfer Pricing, Valuation and Intellectual Property Practice offers a full range of independent advice, and valuation support by world-class economists who operate in major locations around the globe and who team effectively to provide global solutions for multinational clients. Our direct, hands-on approach enables us to develop more rigorous, higher quality products, and to collaborate more effectively with our clients. Clients range from some of the largest and best-known companies in the world to mid-size companies, and they cover numerous iconic brands.

We have an immediate opening for a full-time Economic Analyst in Paris, ideally starting in Spring 2020. Economic Analysts are responsible for developing detailed industry analyses, financial and economic models, and conducting quantitative, statistical and comparative valuation analyses. They are also expected to contribute to the preparation of economic and financial reports.

The Paris team works with a wide range of industries such as Energy; Transportation; Telecommunication; Fashion; Cosmetics; Luxury; Retail; Life Science etc.

The Paris team works on projects involving assets and company valuation; intercompany transaction pricing for products and services; intellectual property mapping and analysis; pricing of financial instruments; assistance to contract negotiation in relation to remuneration clauses, Tax audits assistance, quantification of damages arising from commercial and Intellectual Property-related disputes; as well as International Arbitration.

The successful candidate will work primarily within the Valuation Intellectual Property, and Transfer Pricing team in Paris as well as with other practices within NERA. They would join a dynamic and inspiring team of PhDs, graduates from the Grandes Ecoles and top tier universities, who work globally with NERA’s other European and US offices, on challenging technical topics. Given the size of the team, new joiners are proactively integrated within the team and join projects from the start.

You will need

Candidates must hold a master’s or PhD qualification from a top tier university, in Economics, Finance or a related discipline with exceptional analytical skills and strong academic records.
Ideal candidates will have a mixed economic and financial valuation background with three years’ experience working in corporate finance or valuations. Experience in Transfer Pricing would be an advantage.
Qualified candidates must be detail-oriented and have the ability to think analytically and critically, and have excellent technical, oral and written communication skills.
Business fluency in English and French is essential and other European languages would be an advantage.

What we offer

Competitive salary and flexible benefits package.
The opportunity to work with an international team of highly experienced professionals in a dynamic consulting environment.
Work on high profile cases and with clients across the globe
Firm-sponsored social activities
There may be an opportunity for international travel

Application process

To apply for this position, please submit your CV and a cover letter. For more information about NERA, please visit our website (www.nera.com).

Senior Marketing Business Analyst

International Business Analytics

About GW Pharmaceuticals

GW Pharmaceuticals is a cutting-edge UK-based biopharmaceutical company that over the last 20 years has established a world-leading position in cannabinoid science and the development of regulatory approved medicines derived from cannabis. Our mission is to transform the lives of seriously ill patients and their families. In October 2018 our achievements were recognized by TIME magazine which named GW as one of the ‘Top 50 Genius companies of 2018 that are inventing the future’.

Having developed the world’s first prescription medicine derived from the cannabis plant, Sativex®, which treats spasticity due to multiple sclerosis, GW has now developed an oral formulation of purified cannabidiol (CBD), (approved as Epidyolex® in Europe) for use as adjunctive therapy of seizures associated with Lennox Gastaut syndrome (LGS) or Dravet syndrome (DS), in conjunction with clobazam, for patients 2 years of age and older. Lennox-Gastaut syndrome or Dravet Syndrome are two rare and severe early-onset, drug-resistant epilepsy syndromes. CBD is approved in the US as Epidiolex. This is in addition to our deep pipeline of clinical stage cannabinoid candidates under development for both orphan and non-orphan indications with a particular focus on neurological conditions.

In the UK, we have close to 550 employees from a diverse range of backgrounds and disciplines based on four sites in Cambridge, Kent, London and Andover, along with employees working in the field. We also have a strong presence in the U.S. with around 250 U.S. employees, based both in Carlsbad, CA and in the field.

We are continuing to build out our teams and are looking for talented individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit, dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our patients, and to exemplifying our company values.

Please go to www.gwpharm.com for additional information.

JobDescription :
The role: Senior Research & Design Analyst

The location: London

The grade: G10 (internal use only)

Role Purpose:

The role will support senior analysts within Research and Design to design new S&P Dow Jones Indices covering all capital markets – equities, fixed income, commodities and real estate. Experience in portfolio construction techniques and financial theories will be valuable in delivering innovative index solutions and analysis to clients.

A high level of numeracy, expertise in programming, and the ability to handle large data set will be critical to the role. Effective communication of the work and its conclusions is also essential.

The role would benefit from someone with an awareness of topical market trends and a desire to translate investment objectives into systematic and actionable index strategies. The role will encompass all elements of the index design lifecycle; including background research, client-engagement, data gathering, back-testing and finalizing index methodologies.

The role will also support our thought leadership program by contributing to presentations and research papers. Finally, the role also involves designing and constructing new platforms and processes to enable a more effective and efficient environment for the team.

Accountabilities:
Support in the research and design of new indices across all asset classes
Manage, clean and transform large and complex datasets
Build a comprehensive understanding of the process behind and availability of data from our providers
Back-test the performance of index concepts to assess fulfilment of investment objectives
Utilize programming skills in a proficient manner to:
ensure robust and efficient index design
build internal platforms and tools to improve capabilities and resolve repeatable processes
Write finalized index methodology documents for external use
Prepare and update presentation slides for internal and external events
Support thought-leadership papers for brand promotion
Other Responsibilities:
Work within Global Research and Design and other departments to manage projects that will facilitate the design of new indices.
Must be able to manage multiple projects and deadlines. The projects involve; requirements gathering, data gathering, analytical thinking, index research and design, and documentation.
Must be able to clearly communicate to a number of internal stakeholders.
Hiring Manager Quote:

This role provides a wonderful opportunity to learn the basics (“nuts and bolts”) of fund management and will provide a solid foundation to a career in this area of finance. The ideal candidate must be highly numerate, computer literate, thoughtful, curious, and will have remarkable enthusiasm and drive to learn. Moreover, the candidate must enjoy working collaboratively.

Furthermore, given how complex and dynamic the industry is becoming the candidate will gain exposure to alternative data sets, sophisticated portfolio construction techniques, and a broad and robust range of quantitative methods in finance.

Required Skills:
Demonstrate an appreciation of asset classes and financial theories that underpin portfolio & index construction.
Bachelor’s Degree. Advanced degree in computer science, math, engineering, economics, or finance strongly preferred.
Commitment to studying the CFA
Knowledge of Python and/or Matlab strongly preferred.
Superior computer skills in Microsoft Excel. Ability to program in VBA
Must be able to work independently and take the lead on multiple projects.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent analytical and quantitative capabilities to solve original, non-routine problems in a timely and insightful manner.
Comfortable working with large data sets.

About the opportunity


Department Description

Investment Management Technology provides systems development, implementation and support services for Fidelity International’s global Investment Management division. We support Fund Managers, Research Analysts, Traders and other supporting groups in all of Fidelity International’s locations, including London, Dublin, Hong Kong, Toronto and Tokyo.

The Trading team have strong rapport with the investment management teams notably the trading teams in Equity, Fixed Income, FX and Derivatives. The candidate ideal candidate would have experience with Order Management and Trading functions within Charles River (other OMS applications will be considered). Requirements Planning and Management
Work with Project Managers and Business Sponsors to agree on the Terms of Reference
Ensure that all Stakeholders have a common understanding of what is being delivered
Be self-sufficient in identifying and understanding business requirement/issues
Identify & escalate as appropriate, issues & instances where an agreed target or deadline is at risk or will not be met i.e. works to deadlines and manages client expectations
Requirements Analysis and Documentation
Form part of the conversation with the IM business on their target operating model
Identify requirements effectively and efficiently
Produce different forms of analysis documentation to an appropriate and agreed level of depth including Workflow / Swimlane diagrams, use case diagrams, component diagrams, story narrative documents, business requirement documents,
Deliver presentations and workshop sessions on requirements and solutions to stakeholder groups, clients and colleagues
Regularly review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes, estimates and recommendations relating to the proposed solution, to ensure they are up to date throughout the life cycle of the project
Generation of brief and clear documents that are fit for purpose i.e. appropriate to business issue, focused and suitable/tailored to the target audience.
The construction and maintenance of user guides and training material
Ensuring continuity by follow existing approaches and terminology where appropriate
Problem Solving
This is a key aspect of a Trading Business Analyst and the following aspects are highly valued Simple solutions, User centric, Standardisation and reuse of existing solutions and solving the problem without gold plating
Embedding (e.g. Testing, Training, Support, Process Re-engineering etc.)
Support the Test function with knowledge that aids test scripting & execution, including handovers & walkthroughs
Work with the Test team to define defects, acceptable tolerances within various types of testing
Test Automation progress activities on automated testing and contribute to / generate Feature files
Agile
FIL utilises Agile development practices and the candidate will need to contribute to: Stand Ups, Sprint Planning, Backlog Management and Retrospectives.
Collegiality
Contribute positively to the team in a collaborative fashion adopting and improving existing patterns and process
Other aspects would include Elicits and contributes to peer review, works independently, projects an assured presence, fails well, thinks outside the box, accepts and adapts to feedback
Experience and Qualifications Required

Skills
Excellent requirements analysis and consultative skills, with a logical approach to problem solving delivering simple and appropriate solutions
Ability to operate effectively with limited oversight
Excellent communication (written & oral), interpersonal and relationship management skills
Ability to work in a demanding and fast paced environment with speed and discipline
Confident working with senior management across multiple business areas
Ability to review proposed solutions and make recommendations
Comfortable with both SQL and Excel for analysis and problem resolution
Knowledge of PowerBI and Python would be a bonus
Industry Domain
Legislation - MiFID II, Compliance, RFR, DTO, CSDR
Financial Instruments: Equity, Bond, Future, CFD, Swaps, Options, Swaptions
Asset Management - Exposure, Duration, Risk Management, Attribution and Trading
Trade life cycle - Order gen, execution, settlement, rebooks, positions, corporate actions
Product Domain
FIX - Purpose, Configuration, Custom tags
CRD Configuration - Layouts, Blotters, Queries, Work Flow Rules, Sec Types, Investment Classes, Pricing, Analytics, Compliance Rule generation and testing, Permissions, Data Dictionary
CRD Product - NMWB, OMS and Compliance
CRD Release 17R1 or greater
EMS/MTF - TSOX, Tradeweb, Triton, EMSX, MarketAxess, and LiquidNet
Agile

Job Title: Senior Accountant - Global Financial Accounting & Controls
Job Description:
We are seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Accounting organisation and become a major contributor to our Accounting team. As key member of the UK and Global Accounting team, this individual will be based in London. A successful candidate in this position will have demonstrable experience with financial reporting and internal control related responsibilities.

In addition to the accounting and reporting responsibilities, the individual will drive cross-border projects and develop best practice in processes and controllership on an international level. They will also drive implementation of policies with the financial leadership team based out of worldwide Amazon locations.

Candidates for this position will have held supervisory or management positions in companies with less than one billion in annual revenues, will have worked for a big four public accounting firm at the manager level with Fortune 500 clients or equivalent, or have worked in a large public company as a manager. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate they were top performers at their level.


Basic Qualifications

· BA/BS required
· ACCA, ACA, and CIMA or similar credentials
· Relevant accounting experience (public accounting /industry mix preferred)
· Exposure to operational accounting concepts of inventory, procurement, payables, receivables, and revenue
· Demonstrated ability participating in milestone driven projects
· A strong desire to exceed expectations
· Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
· Solid organizational, project management skills, and information technology aptitude

The ideal candidates will be experienced, talented finance or accounting professionals who are passionate and excited about accounting and reporting and have experience with the details of a monthly close cycle, periodic financial reporting and related analytical analysis.

Traits we are looking for in a candidate are a strong desire to exceed expectations, effective interpersonal skills; including persuasive written and oral communication, solid organizational skills, ability to assess and manage risk, and willingness to get into the details whilst also seeing and understanding the big picture.

Preferred Qualifications

· Worked in a fast paced company similar to a high-tech start-up
· Strong interpersonal written and oral communication skills
· Is naturally a very organizational individual
· Has an aptitude for information technology
· Excellent analytical skills
· Exposure to researching accounting conclusions, documenting support for conclusions reached

Company Description

Colliers International is a leading commercial real estate services company, providing a full range of services to real estate occupiers, developers and investors on a local, national and international basis.

Job Description

The successful candidate will work with the transaction managers, taking a significant responsibility in financial modelling and associated real estate transactional analytical work to assist our clients in making informed and strategic real estate decisions based on robust analysis and financial output.

Essential Responsibilities
Build, utilize and improve highly-customized financial models to analyze real estate scenarios / occupancy alternatives
Support client’s real estate strategy by providing customized, analysis to aid decision making
In collaboration with the transaction manager, provide recommendations based on robust options analysis
Contribute on project calls with the client and client’s customers
Deliver client-facing presentations of financial models, etc.
Ongoing communication with client and account team
Review of lease documents for inputs in financial models
Portfolio planning and analysis
Metroplan support, including data analytics
Transaction reporting including revenue tracking, KPI reporting etc
Bring innovation, enhancement and simplification to existing analytical tools and / or processes
Operational support on project set up and close out
Qualifications

Qualifications
BA or higher in real estate, finance or related area with a record of high academic achievement
Exceptional analytical ability, both financial and qualitative including use of logic
Ability to develop complex Excel models for efficiencies and scenario analysis which would include both the use of VBA (macros) and complex formulas such as lookup, index, dsum, and sumproduct arrays
Solid understanding of real estate and lease terminology
Proficiency with other Microsoft Office products, including Access
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Prior experience in consulting, real estate, capital markets or banking industries
Additional Information

Please note - Agency introductions will not be recognised.

Acumen Solutions is currently hiring Salesforce Business Analysts to join the team in our London, UK location.

Roles and Responsibilities

As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to Fortune 500 Companies and Government Agencies. Our Salesforce Business Analysts wear many hats on their projects and are responsible for everything from requirements gathering, Salesforce configuration, testing, training and post deployment support. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects and Technical Architects to design, develop, and deploy large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.

Key roles and responsibilities include:
Work with clients and end users to gather, understand, and define business requirements

Develop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions for our clients

Work collaboratively with team members to design a solution that will meet a client’s business requirements and fulfill user stories

Complete the configuration for user stories within Salesforce, AppExchange products, or other cloud-based technologies

Collaborate with developers to test and verify that solutions will meet the business requirements

Participate in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user training

Requirements

Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Products to develop client or business solutions

Hands on experience configuring Salesforce or similar CRM Product, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls

Proven ability leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast paced environment

Detail-oriented individual with the ability to quickly ramp up on new clients, their business needs, and technologies

Strong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skills

Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environment

Demonstrates flexibility and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done

Drive and desire to learn and grow both technical and functional skill sets

Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio
Salesforce Admin Certification and one Consulting Cloud Certification (Sales, Service or Community)
Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent

Ability to travel up to 50%

Preferred Experience and Skills

Experience leveraging and configuring AppExchange products to develop a solution

Experience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirements

Experience documenting user stories and creating to-be process flow diagrams

Experience collaborating with business stakeholders

Experience on a Salesforce implementation through the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder
Benefits

Acumen Solutions offers the opportunity for growth and advancement, as well as a competitive base salary, annual performance based incentives, medical and pension schemes, income protection, holiday/sick leave, and more.

Engage with us at www.acumensolutions.com or on Twitter @AcumenSolutions.

Acumen Solutions is currently hiring Salesforce Business Analysts to join the team in our London, UK location.

Roles and Responsibilities

As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to Fortune 500 Companies and Government Agencies. Our Salesforce Business Analysts wear many hats on their projects and are responsible for everything from requirements gathering, Salesforce configuration, testing, training and post deployment support. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects and Technical Architects to design, develop, and deploy large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.

Key roles and responsibilities include:
Work with clients and end users to gather, understand, and define business requirements

Develop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions for our clients

Work collaboratively with team members to design a solution that will meet a client’s business requirements and fulfill user stories

Complete the configuration for user stories within Salesforce, AppExchange products, or other cloud-based technologies

Collaborate with developers to test and verify that solutions will meet the business requirements

Participate in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user training

Requirements

Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Products to develop client or business solutions

Hands on experience configuring Salesforce or similar CRM Product, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls

Proven ability leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast paced environment

Detail-oriented individual with the ability to quickly ramp up on new clients, their business needs, and technologies

Strong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skills

Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environment

Demonstrates flexibility and willingness to do what it takes to get the job done

Drive and desire to learn and grow both technical and functional skill sets

Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and Visio
Salesforce Admin Certification and one Consulting Cloud Certification (Sales, Service or Community)
Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent

Ability to travel up to 50%

Preferred Experience and Skills

Experience leveraging and configuring AppExchange products to develop a solution

Experience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirements

Experience documenting user stories and creating to-be process flow diagrams

Experience collaborating with business stakeholders

Experience on a Salesforce implementation through the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder
Benefits

Acumen Solutions offers the opportunity for growth and advancement, as well as a competitive base salary, annual performance based incentives, medical and pension schemes, income protection, holiday/sick leave, and more.

About the opportunity


Department Description

Investment Management Technology provides systems development, implementation and support services for Fidelity International’s global Investment Management division. We support Fund Managers, Research Analysts, Traders and other supporting groups in all of Fidelity International’s locations, including London, Dublin, Hong Kong, Toronto and Tokyo.

The Trading team have strong rapport with the investment management teams notably the trading teams in Equity, Fixed Income, FX and Derivatives. Projects range in scale and scope and will expose BAs to Portfolio Managers, Compliance, Operational teams, Regulatory Teams and pretty much every aspect of Asset Management.

Purpose of the Role

The role is within the Trading Platform team delivering ongoing RTB/ CTB activities to support business development and the requirements of the platform’s end users. The CRD platform is central to FIL’s IM practices and the candidate should have a proven track record in stakeholder management and project delivery for Front Office clients but also encompassing, middle office and technical teams. The candidate ideal candidate would have experience with Order Management and Trading functions within Charles River (other OMS applications will be considered). Stakeholder management is a key aspect of the role as BA’s operate with a great deal of autonomy being responsible for project delivery.

Key Responsibilities

Project Execution
Provide input into project timelines, estimation, action plans and risk management procedures
Ensure timely completion of work packages in line with project deadline and schedule
Act as a proxy customer facilitating open communication between the customer and development teams
Requirements Planning and Management
Work with Project Managers and Business Sponsors to agree on the Terms of Reference
Ensure that all Stakeholders have a common understanding of what is being delivered
Be self-sufficient in identifying and understanding business requirement/issues
Identify & escalate as appropriate, issues & instances where an agreed target or deadline is at risk or will not be met i.e. works to deadlines and manages client expectations
Requirements Analysis and Documentation
Form part of the conversation with the IM business on their target operating model
Identify requirements effectively and efficiently
Produce different forms of analysis documentation to an appropriate and agreed level of depth including Workflow / Swimlane diagrams, use case diagrams, component diagrams, story narrative documents, business requirement documents,
Deliver presentations and workshop sessions on requirements and solutions to stakeholder groups, clients and colleagues
Regularly review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes, estimates and recommendations relating to the proposed solution, to ensure they are up to date throughout the life cycle of the project
Generation of brief and clear documents that are fit for purpose i.e. appropriate to business issue, focused and suitable/tailored to the target audience.
The construction and maintenance of user guides and training material
Ensuring continuity by follow existing approaches and terminology where appropriate
Problem Solving
This is a key aspect of a Trading Business Analyst and the following aspects are highly valued Simple solutions, User centric, Standardisation and reuse of existing solutions and solving the problem without gold plating
Embedding (e.g. Testing, Training, Support, Process Re-engineering etc.)
Support the Test function with knowledge that aids test scripting & execution, including handovers & walkthroughs
Work with the Test team to define defects, acceptable tolerances within various types of testing
Test Automation progress activities on automated testing and contribute to / generate Feature files
Agile
FIL utilises Agile development practices and the candidate will need to contribute to: Stand Ups, Sprint Planning, Backlog Management and Retrospectives.
Collegiality
Contribute positively to the team in a collaborative fashion adopting and improving existing patterns and process
Other aspects would include Elicits and contributes to peer review, works independently, projects an assured presence, fails well, thinks outside the box, accepts and adapts to feedback
Experience and Qualifications Required

Skills
Excellent requirements analysis and consultative skills, with a logical approach to problem solving delivering simple and appropriate solutions
Ability to operate effectively with limited oversight
Excellent communication (written & oral), interpersonal and relationship management skills
Ability to work in a demanding and fast paced environment with speed and discipline
Confident working with senior management across multiple business areas
Ability to review proposed solutions and make recommendations
Comfortable with both SQL and Excel for analysis and problem resolution
Knowledge of PowerBI and Python would be a bonus
Industry Domain
Legislation - MiFID II, Compliance, RFR, DTO, CSDR
Financial Instruments: Equity, Bond, Future, CFD, Swaps, Options, Swaptions
Asset Management - Exposure, Duration, Risk Management, Attribution and Trading
Trade life cycle - Order gen, execution, settlement, rebooks, positions, corporate actions
Product Domain
FIX - Purpose, Configuration, Custom tags
CRD Configuration - Layouts, Blotters, Queries, Work Flow Rules, Sec Types, Investment Classes, Pricing, Analytics, Compliance Rule generation and testing, Permissions, Data Dictionary
CRD Product - NMWB, OMS and Compliance
CRD Release 17R1 or greater
EMS/MTF - TSOX, Tradeweb, Triton, EMSX, MarketAxess, and LiquidNet
Agile
Jira, Confluence, SharePoint, SDLC
About you
About Fidelity International


Fidelity International offers world class investment solutions and retirement expertise. As a privately owned, independent company, investment is our only business. We are driven by the needs of our clients, not by shareholders. Our vision is to deliver innovative client solutions for a better future.

Our people are passionate, engaged, smart and curious, and we give them the independence and the confidence to make a difference. While we take pride in the excellence of our investment solutions and client service, we know we can always do better. We are honest, respectful and make tough calls, challenging the status quo to achieve better outcomes through innovation. Above all else, we always put our clients first.

Job Title: Senior Accountant - Global Financial Accounting & Controls
Job Description:
We are seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Accounting organisation and become a major contributor to our Accounting team. As key member of the UK and Global Accounting team, this individual will be based in London. A successful candidate in this position will have demonstrable experience with financial reporting and internal control related responsibilities.

In addition to the accounting and reporting responsibilities, the individual will drive cross-border projects and develop best practice in processes and controllership on an international level. They will also drive implementation of policies with the financial leadership team based out of worldwide Amazon locations.

Candidates for this position will have held supervisory or management positions in companies with less than one billion in annual revenues, will have worked for a big four public accounting firm at the manager level with Fortune 500 clients or equivalent, or have worked in a large public company as a manager. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate they were top performers at their level.


Basic Qualifications

· BA/BS required
· ACCA, ACA, and CIMA or similar credentials
· Relevant accounting experience (public accounting /industry mix preferred)
· Exposure to operational accounting concepts of inventory, procurement, payables, receivables, and revenue
· Demonstrated ability participating in milestone driven projects
· A strong desire to exceed expectations
· Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
· Solid organizational, project management skills, and information technology aptitude

The ideal candidates will be experienced, talented finance or accounting professionals who are passionate and excited about accounting and reporting and have experience with the details of a monthly close cycle, periodic financial reporting and related analytical analysis.

Traits we are looking for in a candidate are a strong desire to exceed expectations, effective interpersonal skills; including persuasive written and oral communication, solid organizational skills, ability to assess and manage risk, and willingness to get into the details whilst also seeing and understanding the big picture.

Preferred Qualifications

· Worked in a fast paced company similar to a high-tech start-up
· Strong interpersonal written and oral communication skills
· Is naturally a very organizational individual
· Has an aptitude for information technology
· Excellent analytical skills
· Exposure to researching accounting conclusions, documenting support for conclusions reached

Company Description

Colliers International is a leading commercial real estate services company, providing a full range of services to real estate occupiers, developers and investors on a local, national and international basis.

Job Description

The successful candidate will work with the transaction managers, taking a significant responsibility in financial modelling and associated real estate transactional analytical work to assist our clients in making informed and strategic real estate decisions based on robust analysis and financial output.

Essential Responsibilities
Build, utilize and improve highly-customized financial models to analyze real estate scenarios / occupancy alternatives
Support client’s real estate strategy by providing customized, analysis to aid decision making
In collaboration with the transaction manager, provide recommendations based on robust options analysis
Contribute on project calls with the client and client’s customers
Deliver client-facing presentations of financial models, etc.
Ongoing communication with client and account team
Review of lease documents for inputs in financial models
Portfolio planning and analysis
Metroplan support, including data analytics
Transaction reporting including revenue tracking, KPI reporting etc
Bring innovation, enhancement and simplification to existing analytical tools and / or processes
Operational support on project set up and close out
Qualifications

Qualifications
BA or higher in real estate, finance or related area with a record of high academic achievement
Exceptional analytical ability, both financial and qualitative including use of logic
Ability to develop complex Excel models for efficiencies and scenario analysis which would include both the use of VBA (macros) and complex formulas such as lookup, index, dsum, and sumproduct arrays
Solid understanding of real estate and lease terminology
Proficiency with other Microsoft Office products, including Access
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Prior experience in consulting, real estate, capital markets or banking industries
Additional Information

Please note - Agency introductions will not be recognised.
